Property description: Located in a quiet turning is this large extended three bedroom 1930's home with space and natural light in abundance. On entry to this property, once you are through the porch, you are greeted by a large hallway with coving throughout leading on to a separate reception room, which the owners had separated from the original through lounge during their tenure.  A second sperate room offers the current owners a play room, whilst a large rear extension creates the open plan kitchen/diner, suitable for a large family or for when guests pop over to visit. To the first floor there are three bedrooms and a large family bathroom, whilst outdoor space includes a garden measuring in excess of 80 feet!! Located within a short walk of a number of local shops, whilst also being within a stone throw of Morrisons and Sainsburys, puts this home in a fantastic position for the new owners to enjoy. Our vendors have been at this property for over 30 years, and will truly miss the neighbours and the sense of community, demonstrating that this would make another family happy for many years. Call us today to arrange your viewing.

A characterful six bedroom double-fronted Victorian semi-detached house positioned on a popular tree-lined residential road. This generously proportioned (2295 sq ft / 213.2 sq m) property is arranged over three levels and has been improved and upgraded by the current owner to offer an ideal long-term opportunity for a young or growing family. A welcoming entrance hall leads to two sizeable reception rooms and a study which boast original period features such as fireplaces, coving, and sash windows. The rear reception has solid oak flooring, a working fireplace and French doors to the garden.  The remainder of the ground floor comprises of a WC, a modern kitchen with plenty of storage and a 17ft conservatory / breakfast room with under floor heating. This space provides a quiet sanctuary to enjoy sunny days and wildlife overlooking the garden. The first floor is made up of three bedrooms (with a complete wall of fitted wardrobes to the master), a family bathroom, and a separate shower room / dressing room. A large arched window floods the stairwell with light and leads to the top floor which houses three further bedrooms and includes eaves storage and exposed brickwork. Externally there is a mature walled rear garden with fruit trees, a patio seating area and sunny southerly aspect. Also, a 33ft detached tandem garage which could be perfect for a workshop, studio, or home office. This location offers access to nearby rail links such as Birkbeck, Anerley, and Norwood Junction (fast to London Bridge), as well as handy amenities and proximity to the popular Stuart Fleming Primary school. A viewing of this well cared-for property is essential to appreciate the accommodation.  EPC: E | Council Tax Band F

The PropertyNewly presented to the market, we have this magnificent family home which has been in the same ownership for the past 52 years.  Full of period features and both elegantly and effortlessly charming, this voluminous 3 storey house (with cellar) is now ready for a family to come in and write the next chapter in its history.  It has 2 reception rooms, 2 bathrooms and 4 bedrooms * as well as a roof terrace and a private garden. It could be moved into or expanded/developed/refurbished, subject to all the usual permissions.  A lovely home or a great opportunity - or an investment to the right buyer.But the best bit is the area - what a place to live!  Clapham High Street, Clapham Old Town in one direction and in the other direction you have Stockwell and Brixton with their own unique feel!! The location is great as it is close enough to Central London for commuting/entertainment etc and is situated in close proximity to a recently established 24/7hr gym.  The property benefits from very good transport links, being just a short walk from several stations including; Stockwell Underground Station (Victoria Line & Northern Line) and Clapham North Underground Station (Northern Line) as well as being  covered by several bus services.  Head towards the Wandsworth Road and you have a flagship Sainsbury’s, local restaurants and shops, and primary school are within a short walk as well as Central London/London Eye etc. This means it is suitable not just for those wanting to live in a great area, but also those needing to commute. There is plenty of green space, with Larkhall Park a stone's throw away, and Clapham Common nearby.In summary, a really good place to live and/or invest.( *Please note that bedroom 4 has been used many years ago as a kitchen but is being recognised as a bedroom on our floorplan)Disclaimer for virtual viewingsSome or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. Element Properties & Co are proud to present this immaculate four bedroom detached house, set within a modern, private development in the Bounds Green / Bowes Park area.Boasting over c159 SQM (c1709 SQFT) of lateral space; this exceptional architecturally designed property is comprised of four double bedrooms, a large open plan kitchen/living room, three bathrooms (one en-suite), and landscaped front and rear gardens, all in addition to a media room. The property has a fantastic energy rating of B (assisted by the discrete solar panels on the roof).Exquisitely designed from top to bottom, this home offers a chic interior and finish throughout. Located in a secluded private estate with off-street parking, gates on each side of the development (allowing a cut through to Bounds Green), the property presents a unique experience given the wonderful bio-diverse woodland in which it resides and its detached nature both symbolically and physically from the busy London lifestyle.The key benefits London has to offer can all be found on this home’s doorstep whilst maintaining green surroundings. Bounds Green Station is situated only 0.3 miles away (Piccadilly Line) - offering links around North and Central London. Passing stops include Finsbury Park, Holborn, Kings Cross and Leicester Square alongside a variety of others. As a note, Finsbury Park Station is only a 15 minute train journey on the Underground. Moreover, Bowes Park (0.2 miles) and Alexandra Palace (0.4 miles) stations offer direct links to Highbury & Islington and Moorgate - in 15 and 25 minutes respectively.   The property is positioned around the corner from the community centred Myddelton Road, boasting a variety of shops and cafes. The vibrant offerings of Muswell Hill and Green Lanes can both be found only a short walk away and the colourful markets and parks of Alexandra Palace offer a great escape from bustling city life. Thereafter, Alexandra Park and Myddleton Road both provide Sunday markets offering a huge spread from local produce, groceries all the way to vintage gear! Both spaces are a must see for anyone looking to move in the area as the community spirit cannot be better reflected than taking a stroll through these colourful markets. Viewings are highly recommended to ascertain the uniqueness of this property.The property is offered with a Freehold title.

Within a gated mews in Walthamstow Village, setting a new benchmark for sustainable design. The homes are the result of five years of design development and are being built around three main pillars: to be carbon negative, with zero construction waste and net energy positive and so set to incur no utility bills. The homes are fully electric, powered by 198 solar panels all EPC A rated. The majority of the features in the homes have been designed bespoke for The Arbour and include compressed earth brick walls and lampshades made from site soil, worktops made from wood shavings from the timber frame, shower panels from recycled plastics and more. The interior design is by Rockett St George, who have carefully curated each space and fixture to align with the aspirations of the project and debuts their new sustainable furniture range. Materials have been selected to look good, to be low carbon and to require little maintenance.  The Arbour benefits from an abundance of communal landscaped spaces, including a central community garden that will include vegetable patches, foraging, outdoor kitchen and seating. The gardens have been landscaped by the award-winning London Glades, to be self-sustainable over time and to provide a safe and enjoyable space for families to come together. The development also includes a re-use centre, an electric car club vehicle, and electric and traditional bicycles all exclusively reserved for residents.

Within a gated mews in Walthamstow Village, setting a new benchmark for sustainable development. The homes are the result of five years of design development and are being built around three main pillars: to be carbon negative, with zero construction waste and net energy positive and so set to incur no utility bills. The homes are fully electric, powered solely by solar panels and are all EPC A rated. The majority of the features in the homes have been designed bespoke for The Arbour and include compressed earth brick walls and lampshades made from site soil, worktops made from wood shavings from the timber frame, shower panels from recycled plastics and more.IF YOU LIVED HERE The interior design is by Rockett St George, who have carefully curated each space and fixture to align with the aspirations of the project, which debuts their new sustainable furniture range. Materials have been selected portray a contemporary design, to be low carbon and require little maintenance. The Arbour benefits from an abundance of communal landscaped spaces, including a central community garden that will include vegetable patches, foraging, outdoor kitchen and seating. The gardens have been landscaped by the award-winning London Glades, to be self-sustainable over time and to provide a safe and enjoyable space for families to come together. The development also includes a re-use centre, an electric car club vehicle and electric and traditional bicycles all exclusively reserved for residents. WHAT ELSE?- Walthamstow schools are excellent and plentiful, within a one mile radius alone you have twenty eight primary/secondary schools, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted with eight deemed 'Outstanding'.- Your spoilt for choice when it comes to great pubs. The Queen's Arms is the closest, offering excellent food and a great choice of craft beers in a comfortable , traditionally sumptuous environment. - Amongst many other local highlights, Europe's longest street market runs down Walthamstow High Street, less than a half mile stroll away as well as Epping Forest and the Walthamstow Wetlands.While the perks of Walthamstow Village are a mere stone’s throw away, you’ll have your own community on your literal doorstep;....... Residents can ‘live, work and play’ within the space, with access to a covered community garden with an outdoor workstation and kitchen for preparing homegrown food, as well as a reuse centre for exchanging goods between residents.'For me, this development is watershed moment in British construction. The building techniques used have been groundbreaking and once I delved into the details, I was left inspired by the materials used and conscious of how our consumer choices can make a difference.  The project has been carefully curated over 5 years and studies embarked on by GS8 have unearthed issues associated with standard building techniques. With innovative ideas the GS8 team have set about to find solutions to assist this project and help move the industry forward, which in turn will benefit future generations. Purchasers have a rare chance to own a home that in years to come will be recognised as a masterpiece in construction, which challenges not only the way we build but also the way with live.'   Daniel MajeedHead of Land & New Homes

Built in 1832, 55 Beulah Road has always been a commercial building, once a piano manufacturer’s, with the business owners living upstairs & their shop downstairs. This pretty cherry blossom-lined road was Walthamstow’s original high street and continues to be a mix of commercial & residential properties, within a key area in the gentrification of Walthamstow.Extended over most of the plot with a small garden area at the rear, this is no ordinary refurb. The owners have run a successful business here since the 1970s, having always loved the village location. So when they decided to modernise they engaged specialist architects to design and extend the space to a contemporary finish, while preserving  the building’s historic character and attributes. And the result is gorgeous.It’s set over 2 floors, with a reception area at the front, open-plan desk space, storage space, kitchen area, 2 WCs with disabled access & shower room, and a new staircase leading up to meeting rooms.The pitched roof & exposed ceiling joists not only look incredible, they maximise the sense of space; and a glass divide over the party wall provides sound proofing, without compromising the flow of natural light. People love working here because of its homely atmosphere & village location. And the refurb reflects what people want in offices now. The state of the art ventilation system physically changes the air & a fully equipped kitchen gives people the means to make a good meal at lunchtime, with a comfortable space to sit or step outside.Located in the heart of the village, & a short walk from local cafes, restaurants and sports facilities, there’s easy access to transport links by bus, by tube and Overground from Walthamstow Central station, which is a 10 minute walk away or a 4 minute cycle. Ref/JD0093 - CHAIN FREE & Excellent for Professionals, Couples and Young families in an excellent location! Wonderful Mews House with two large double bedrooms (one with ensuite) enjoying south east facing terrace,  is set in a pretty and secluded gated development, offers an opportunity not to be missed. The modern and attractive property is conveniently located around the corner from all the shops and amenities of the desirable South End Green. It is also within proximity to the green spaces of Parliament Hill Fields and Hampstead Heath, whilst Hampstead Heath Overground Station and Belsize Park Underground Station (Northern Line) are just moments away.The property has a crisp, stylish decor with wide wooden floors and double glazed windows throughout and is a peaceful place to relax in.The bright and sun-drenched reception room is open plan with a fully fitted modern kitchen and on the first floor. It benefits from an exceptionally high vaulted ceiling, adding depth and character to the living area and allowing space for larger light fixtures to hang from the ceiling should one desire. It also benefits from wall to wall sliding doors with bespoke shutters, opening to a large balcony. Sitting out on the private balcony with a coffee or glass of wine on a warm summer evening offers a wonderful way to unwind and entertain.The two bathrooms are recently refurbished to a high standard. The family bathroom is a very good size with a shower, whilst the other one is the ensuite with a bath. The two double bedrooms are large and proportionate. The one that has the ensuite is on the ground floor and is currently being used as a home office, perfect for people working from home. It can easily be used as a guest room too whilst the other bedroom on the split level enjoys floor to ceiling sliding doors, opening to a lovely patio. Spacious and well-maintained, this house offers everything you could possibly want to serve a busy lifestyle. Set within a desirable area, it is perfect for professionals, couples, young families and investors due to its excellent position for the tube station, all local amenities, and transport links to the city centre.NW3Some say that living in NW3 means you’ve reached the pinnacle of London life. This postcode is one of the most sought after (and affluent) in the UK. It offers peaceful, idyllic village settings just a few miles away from Central London and buzzy areas like  Camden and includes both Hampstead and Belsize Park within. Classed as the 'world's finest urban village', Hampstead is celebrated for its intellectual, artistic and musical associations.Affluent Belsize Park is home to cafes, delis, bakeries, and independent boutiques in the area around Belsize Village and England’s Lane, while smart bistros serve Spanish, Italian, and pan-Asian cuisine. The Everyman Belsize Park cinema shows classic and arthouse movies. Quiet, leafy residential streets are lined with quaint mews houses and Georgian and Victorian villas converted into spacious apartments.South End GreenSouth End Green is a pocket of Hampstead positioned next to the Heath, home to excellent shops, transport links and the Royal Free Hospital. Wedged between Hampstead, Belsize Park, and Hampstead Heath, South End Green is a place with a distinct, lively identity that's increasingly becoming a magnet for both locals and visitors, thanks to its many food and drink offerings and relaxed, friendly, welcoming atmosphere. The well regarded Daunt Books and one of London's oldest bakeries, Euphorium, contribute to an attractive shopping area,South End Green has Conservation Area status and consists of mostly late Victorian architecture. Hampstead Heath Overground station is located here, alongside a handy bus station.Hampstead HeathMillions flock to Hampstead Heath each year to explore the 800 acres of open space. The Heath provides sprawling countryside in a London setting with rolling meadows, scenic trails, rugged woodland and an abundance of local wildlife.Head to Parliament Hill for sweeping views of London or visit one of three public ponds where many go for a dip.

Beautifully Presented Three Bedroom Period Home in Popular Spot. You'll just love this perfectly placed three bedroom Victorian gem. Located within an easy stroll of the very best of Camberwell and Peckham, the property comprises a lovely double reception, contemporary kitchen/diner, three lovely bedrooms, bathroom and handy wc. The rear patio garden is well presented and low maintenance. The location is highly prized being within moments from Bellenden Village, Camberwell and Peckham. Even closer is the very lovely Lucas Gardens. Transport links abound with nearby Denmark Hill Station and Peckham Rye Station (both a 12 minute walk) and any number of bus routes on nearby Peckham Road. It is also a 25 minute cycle into town.A handsome exterior encourages you from the mature, peaceful street. Inside you meet high ceilings and ornate cornice work. The double reception sits on the right with more cornicing and marvellous matching fireplaces. You'll enjoy ample dining, lounging and entertaining space. Toward the end of the hall you find the top notch contemporary kitchen/diner which has a side bay window and oodles of counter space. Appliances include a four ring gas hob, oven, integrated dishwasher and fridge freezer. Glass doors open full width to the rear offering access to your pretty patio garden. Heading upward you find a spacious landing with laundry cupboard. The master bedroom fronts the street with a wall of fab fitted wardrobes and two windows. A second lovely double bedroom sits next door with a peaceful rear aspect. The bathroom enjoys delicious tiling over the bath and in the shower. There's plenty of shelf space for lotions, potions and towels and three side facing window for light and airiness. Your third and final bedroom, a well proportioned single room, will comfortably house a double bed. There's a handy local shop within seconds of your front door (great for milk and the like). South London Art Gallery and Camberwell College of Arts are minutes away for a spot of cultural activity. For those with small children, The Villa Nursery and Lyndhurst Primary are very close. Going to work? Reach Peckham Rye or Denmark Hill stations in about 12 minutes for frequent, fast services to central London and beyond. The London Overground further increases your connectivity to the tube network. You can get to Clapham High Street in a mere 5 minutes. Shoreditch and Islington are easy and Canary Wharf (via Canada Water) will take around 15 minutes. Grab one of the many buses running along Peckham Road (moments away); these will take you pretty much anywhere you want to go! Settle the weekly shop at Dog Kennel Hill Sainsbury's, just two minutes in the car. Bountiful Bellenden Road is an easy stroll for yet more social attractions.

This award winning development is set within a secure gated mews in South West London. This is a unique and spacious two bedroom family home, located only a short distance of Battersea Park, and, with easy access to Clapham Junction and direct lines into London Waterloo. Northcote Road is a short distance away with its array of shops, restaurants, cafés, bars as, an example of a few attractions. Central London can be accessed easily with a direct line in twenty five minutes. There are a range of schools including Thomas’s school, positioned within 0.5miles of the property, and Shillington park, situated outside the gates, hosts all the little leagues for Battersea and Chelsea.Inside the gates, the grounds are well maintained. The front door leads into a large entrance hall with double mirrored cupboards, storage/utility cupboard with space for a washing machine. There are two good size bedrooms, both with wood floors, bay windows, and fitted wardrobes with sensor lights that are activated when opened.   The larger of the rooms has and en-suite shower, wet room, cupboard which is light censored, including a cupboard with shelving for shoes. There is also a family bathroom comprising a bath, separate shower cubicle, WC, wash hand basin and heated towel rail. Both bathrooms have underfloor heating. The garage has an electric front up and over mechanism but is currently being used by the current owner as a study/storage area. There is potential to convert into a further bedroom subject to planning permission. The wood floors extend to the first floor which leads to large open plan room, with high ceiling and Velux electric windows, with blinds. There are floor to ceiling sliding doors to the courtyard area, which allows natural light into the rooms. The room is split into a living area, study area with a space saving wall bed and kitchen. The kitchen has a variety of base level and wall mounted cream gloss units providing ample storage, 4 ring ceramic hob, oven,  extractor hood, integrated dishwasher, and tall standing fridge freezer.The outside terrace area is private and well maintained, ideal for cosy nights and dining. The property is warm inside, offering a generous size living space, including double glazing, gas central heating and the property is offered by the owner with no onward chain. Viewings are highly recommended.

Birnam Road is located within the vacinity one of Islington’s well-preserved Conservation Areas. Local transport is provided through Crouch Hill Overground Station 0.4m away and Victoria Line and Piccadilly Line services can be sought at Finsbury Park Station, just 0.5m away. There is also a fantastic amount of local bus services too into the City and the West End from Hornsey Road.

Brand New 3 Bedroom Terraced Townhouse. This fantastic property features accommodation over four levels boasting 1798sqft of living space. The ground floor utilises a large study room, WC and a large storage area. Stairs lead to the first floor and the spacious living room, modern kitchen/dining room and a further WC, plus access to your landscaped rear garden. Architecturally-treated three bedroom Victorian terrace (built 1908) of 1194 square feet, on a quiet residential back street with unrestricted parking.  The house was fully renovated in 2017; it's been sensitively and artfully-extended both out and up, and boasts both bath and shower rooms. Paint and professional colour consulting impresses throughout (March & Son of Lewes, Sussex), and a well-established rear garden extends over 25 feet (accessed from large folding doors from your dining area).   You're really close to Peckham Rye Park and Common's 113 acres, the beautiful green space of Nunhead cemetery, and also to volunteer-run Aquarius Golf Club. Your local stations are Nunhead, Peckham Rye and Brockley; all are circa a mile from the house (and Fare Zone 2).  From the hall, your formal through-reception rests to your left. Beautifully-laid oak herringbone flooring runs through here - reclaimed from a school in north Wales. Further treats include cast iron radiators, a gas-fuelled stove in woodburner style, and an original fireplace reinstated (not functional); both with slate hearths. The large kitchen/dining room - of over 18 feet by over 11 feet - is accessed from part-glazed timber double-doors (yet another lovely feature). What a room! Marrying old and new harmoniously, you've got a large roof light over the dining area, and a dreamy fitted kitchen from British Standard by Plain English, teamed with Carrera marble and reclaimed Iroko hardwood worktops. Other welcome features include a fitted larder, a boiler cupboard, storage, laundry space for washer/dryer, and a polished concrete floor (with clever water underfloor heating system). At the foot of the delightful room, you have a full-span, narrow-frame sliding glazing system, which fully opens for inside-out dining in the summer months.  Up to the first floor and from the half-landing, you'll find the main bathroom (which was renovated in 2019) to the rear of the house, with sash window, neat and modern white suite, and large built-in cupboard - which is great for towels and such.  From the main landing, find a large and twin-sashed master bedroom across the front of the house (this is over 12 feet by over 11 feet), and your second bedroom's next door (of over 11 feet by over 7 feet). Both rooms have original feature fireplaces, and wool carpets were laid in 2020 (sanded and treated floorboards with 'white wash' are beneath the carpets - if that's more your thing). At the top of the house is a very lovely large loft bedroom, of over 19 feet by over 12 feet. You have Velux and casement windows, and custom-built wardrobes plus accessible eaves storage. A neat and windowed en suite with large walk-in shower completes the house tour.  Green space? Peckham Rye Park & Common is your most local green space (walk five minutes) - comprising a Victorian Park and historic common; a pleasant refuge for both the local community and wildlife. It's home to ornamental gardens, streams, woodland and a lake, playgrounds and a cafe, plus outdoor gym. The park has been awarded Green Flag status and has a long, rich and engaging history - it was recorded as being cultivated before the Norman Conquest in the 11th Century! At the tip of the common you have a host of cool eateries like Mr Bao, Good Neighbour and Banh Banh, and trendy hairdressing salon (Blue Tit).  Bellenden Road, Blenheim Grove and Rye Lane are also close for yummy restaurants (we love Levan, Ganapati, The Begging Bowl and Artusi), cool bars and pubs, Peckham Levels, and The Bussey Building.  You're a short stroll from Nunhead and East Dulwich's town centres too. In Nunhead we like Kudu Grill and El Vermut, plus Ayres bakery and FC Soper wet fish shop. Brockley's also close for more options, and for pubs - The Ivy House, The Waverley, The Herne and The Angel Oak are all strong locals.  Local schools are all good; your most local is Ivydale Primary.

The AreaForest Gate has a history of offering a mosaic of woodland and grazing (it's in the name!), forming part of Wanstead Flats and wider Epping Forest. Not many know about this hidden green oasis in the far reaches of the East End. This one-of-a-kind home was recently completed on a plot in the heart of Forest Gate. Finding a plot of land of this size and potential in London is becoming an increasing rarity, but for Mr C who designed and developed the property, it was an opportunity not to miss. The site was just a post-war gap between houses, left to the elements for too long.  Planning was achieved for a 3-bedroom house on the site, with a split lower and upper-level layout, creating almost a hidden home in residential Newham.Architecture and property'The internal face of the house is all clad in waterproofed cork sheets, perfect for retaining heat and acoustics. It also has a subtle wood bark smell, which defined our relationship with the house', Mr C explains as he walks me through the process of build & eventual design. The soil was of solid clay ground when preparing the site, thus foundation works were smooth, great for the lower floor's concrete 'basin'.  Pink-hued facing bricks are used for the exterior, alongside low-carbon blockwork to form cavity walls, where exposed Douglas Fir roof joists sit on and form the flat green roofs. Mr C explains how they had to use a 'contrasting' material for the taller volume of the roof, so went for corrugated metal sheets to clad the upper level of the house. The house is surrounded by gardens on all sides, which ensures that all the courtyards are visually and physically connected. Skylights are consciously positioned throughout for daylight to stream into the house. Natural materials are used throughout to give a harmony to the aesthetic, with cork sheets lining the cavity walls, treated plywood panels used to line the ceiling and breathable lime render on all internal partitions. The floor is finished with poured resin over underfloor heating; a wonderful treat for barefoot living. Brass kitchen cabinetry is used to bring drama and to reflect light in the centre of the house, a bold statement for a home with otherwise organic finishes. BackgroundMr C talked to me about how he wanted to build beautiful sustainability into the house, which is why they opted for cork sheets.  This sustainable awareness is echoed in the low-carbon blockwork and lime render. The house achieves a blend of being visually attractive whilst retaining the all-important sustainability creds. The level of thoughtfulness brought to the materials throughout the house also delivers cheaper energy bills!As an architect, Mr C has always wanted to build his own house and came across the plot online by chance. Having been living in North London, with no prior connection to Forest Gate, he and his partner suddenly realised what could be achieved, in this exciting location.  In order to achieve planning requirements, the house could not be too tall, so they opted for a half-sunken lower-ground floor level for the principal bedroom and ensuite bathroom. This resulted in a shorter flight of stairs with no landing to reduce the flow around levels, consequently opening up an additional room in the stairwell itself. The windows in the central courtyard also connect the level visually from room to room.As the internal face of the house is cork clad, this keeps heat in and provides additional natural insulation and a textured approach, creating an almost cocoon-like feel to the house.Out and AboutAs this is a genuine East End residential area, it has an obvious energy for regeneration given its proximity to the Elizabeth Line. This area has become increasingly popular with young families, benefitting from a great school network and rapid access to City, Stansted and Luton airports. Close by are Forest Gate Arches, recently regenerated to include an array of great local businesses. Some choice pickings include, Wild Goose Bakery, an artisan bakery, an authentic Italian delicatessen and Pretty Decent Beer Company, an independent brewery just at the end of the road!  The Holly Tree pub just around the corner has been refurbished and is perfect for a Sunday roast.Hackney Wick and Stratford are close by as well, with a vast array of pubs, bars and restaurants, and the Westfield shopping centre is a short drive. A real asset is the proximity to the huge natural areas of Wanstead Flats, and the close proximity to Epping Forest. "Whenever we want to take a break from working at home, we go for a walk in the Flats trying out different paths. It is massive, full of ponds and lakes teeming with nature. Wellies are a must though " said Mr C. Transport LinksForest Gate overground is a 9 minute walk, connecting straight through to Liverpool Street for the City, and linking up with Stratford for the Central Line. Wanstead Park overground is also a 7 minute stroll, linking West to East, and is only two stops to Barking for the district line. An array of 24-hour buses from Forest Road take you straight into Stratford Westfield and the Olympic in under 30 minutes.

Rare to market, 1132 square feet, 2/3 bedroom upside down mews house with south facing patio garden. The house was designed by Julian Cowie Architects and was originally a factory. This substantial property is located on Monsell Road which was previously called Kings Road and later renamed in honour of John Samuel Bewley Monsell who was a prolific Victorian hymn writer, best known for “Fight the good fight” hymn.  The original bay window remains to the front of the property offering a cottage like look to the house. This unique mews house is arranged with three meter height ceilings to the ground level where two main bedrooms and two bathrooms are situated, the main bedroom also benefitting from French doors opening up to a beautiful and south facing patio garden which is demised to the property. Further, neighbouring patio gardens are demised to other mews houses and are interlinked with a communal pathway creating a feeling of a rare London community feel. An extremely spacious living room sits on the first floor which is flooded with light via double aspect windows and skylights to the mezzanine level which is currently used as a library/study but can also accommodate an occasional bedroom, if needed. The ceiling in the living room extends to just over five meters to the front. The kitchen is separate to the living accommodation but can also be opened up if required. This property is extremely flexible to suit any individual needs and is currently designed with modern living in mind. This property is being sold chain free and with a Share of Freehold. Monsell Road is a popular residential road in leafy Highbury and benefits from excellent transport links to the City via the Piccadilly and Victoria lines. It is walking distance to the green open spaces of Highbury Fields, Finsbury Park and Clissold Park..

FULL DESCRIPTION  This quirky and interesting house offers generous accommodation arranged over three floors, boasting two generous double bedrooms with en suite to the main bedroom, with living accommodation spread over the top two floors.The main living area is on the first floor, with separate kitchen complementing a large double aspect living room. To the rear, the Juliet balcony overlooks the private patio leading out to the communal garden of this trendy little London enclave.Stairs lead up to a versatile area on a mezzanine level, great as a home office and occasional third/ guest bedroom. LOCATION AND TENURE  A quite street, Monsell Road is convenient for Victoria, Piccadilly and Overground lines via Finsbury Park Transport Hub, or Drayton Park for a 10 minute journey to Moorgate. Clissold Park, Highbury Fields and Finsbury Park are all within walking distance. There are plenty of amenities nearby with Waitrose on Holloway Rd, The esoteric shops of Highbury Bran including La Fromagerie, Godfrey's butchers, Da Mario's deli and Bournes fishmongersThis property has a share of the freehold, set up to manage the communal areas with a healthy sinking fund.

This house was converted from a factory in the ‘loft style’ by the award-winning Julian Cowie Architects, and retains its original 1890 bay window. It has all the benefits of a terraced house, including its own front door, while offering all of the benefits of the Monsell Court development. There is a reason why these properties rarely come to market: the last one was sold over ten years ago.The ingenious design maximises the space and light throughout the house, with 3m ceilings on the ground floor and a vaulted living area above, giving a huge space to entertain.The mezzanine gallery at the top of the house could be used as a third bedroom, but is currently set up as a library and study for two people, making it the ideal place to work from home.There is a private garden in the south-facing courtyard at the back of a house, and a Juliette balcony which looks out over the palm trees. Monsell Road is a tree-lined street in Highbury West that connects to the ‘Blackstock Village’, with its traditional butcher, greengrocer, bookshop and vintner, along with cafés and restaurants including Fink’s, Beam and Top Cuvée. Gillespie School is around the corner. Clissold Park, Gillespie Park, Finsbury Park and Highbury Fields are all nearby, and the whole of London is within easy reach on the Victoria and Piccadilly lines.Ideal for young families, those looking for something unusual and professionals too. An early viewing is highly recommend.

To the first floor, there are three well proportioned bedrooms - two doubles, with access to a balcony/terrace and luxury four piece en-suite from the rear room, plus a single/study.  A family bathroom completes the first floor accommodation.  To the second floor, there is a further inviting double bedroom with ample inbuilt storage and access to another luxury four piece en-suite bathroom.  To book a viewing instantly just visit our website or download our award-winning App.LocationThe property is conveniently located within easy access of Hendon, Hendon Central and Colindale stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes, all providing excellent cross-London links. There are a variety of shops and amenities within a short distance on The Hyde, as well as a selection of pleasant open spaces including nearby Sunny Hill Park.  Additionally, the site of the Middlesex University is close-by, as well as a number of excellent local schools. A fantastic balance of living space and bedrooms with period features and character throughout. On the ground floor the accommodation comprises a large double reception, downstairs WC and spacious kitchen/diner filled with natural light leading to the wonderful mature garden. The first floor offers a family bathroom and three bedrooms (the pick being the double bedroom at the front of the house with large bay window). A range of well regarded schools to choose from locally including Mount Carmel & Little Ealing Primary. Gunnersbury Park is a fantastic local amenity for the whole family to enjoy.

This modern townhouse provides balanced and versatile family accommodation over three floors. On the ground floor the property has a stylish kitchen with space for dining, which leads to a South West facing garden. A three double bedroom, semi detached Victorian house, organised over two floors. A stunning four-bedroom, chain free Victorian semi-detached family home situated in one of the most sought-after roads in the area close to Hither Green train station and Manor House Gardens.Tucked away on a quiet residential street, this property is part of small collection of properties that have direct views of Manor House Gardens. Measuring 1478 sqft internally, this double stacked bay-fronted Victorian semi has a sunny south-west facing 104ft garden that backs on to Manor Park.This property has undergone a full refurbishment and includes, new double glazed sash windows to the front and back of the property, along with a full rewire, brand-new boiler, kitchen and bathroom.On the ground floor is double-reception room which benefits from high ceilings, two feature fireplaces and lots of natural light. To the rear is the brand-new kitchen/diner, the kitchen units are modern in style, in matt grey, teamed with a white subway tile splash back. Additionally, there is a guest WC, access to the large cellar, and the garden via French doors to the side of the kitchen.The property has four bedrooms and a family bathroom with contemporary white sanitary ware, and an over bath shower. The back bedroom could be a home office and has a unique sunny balcony with views across Manor Park Gardens. A real gem!Hither Green has a variety of local amenities, including popular independent shops, cafes, and restaurants. Blackheath Village is a pleasant 15-minute walk away with an array of fabulous amenities and Blackheath Common. St Margaret’s Primary is a 5-minute walk away from Aislibie Road (rated Outstanding by Ofsted) along with a selection of other 'Good' and 'Outstanding'  Ofsted rated primary schools.With Hither Green and Blackheath stations both equidistant from Aislibie Road (approx 15 minutes’ walk away), there are plenty of options for transport links with trains to London Bridge, Canon Street and Charing Cross. There's also the DLR from Lewisham with services to Canary Wharf and Bank.

An outstanding newly rebuilt and refurbished 1860's freehold live/work warehouse on Havelock Walk, a vibrant, artistic cobbled mews in the heart of bustling Forest Hill. The property, which occupies over 1700 sq/ft, has been completely refurbished throughout to an exemplary, bespoke finish.  This great mews house benefits from spacious, flexible accommodation, dramatic high ceilings, beautiful reclaimed fittings, as well as private outside space. Havelock Walk is an incredibly sought-after private, no-through mews, home to a wide-variety of creative businesses ranging from jewellery-making  through to theatre set design, making this the perfect proposition for a creative, or merely for someone who wants a very unique family home. Forest Hill is a well-connected, leafy enclave with a great choice of independent cafes, bars and restaurants and excellent transport options (London Overground, Rail and bus).

A simply stunning four bedroom terraced house on Lansdowne Road.Modern and minimal this brand new renovation by the current owners has been carefully and lovingly designed to the very highest of standards.  Entering the hallway you are faced with a view of the kitchen extension - a brick archway revealing crittal style doors and a glimpse of the garden. It’s a truly impressive space, wide skylights framing the pitched roof overhead with smooth poured concrete floor below and endless work tops finished in dappled grey with fitted matt white units. The brick wall boasts wide zinc shelves and a rustic zinc cooker, giving a wholesome and industrial feel to the kitchen.  Features such as underfloor heating and a boiling hot water tap ensure this room is kept toasty, even including a wall mount for hanging up your bike on arrival.  It’s a multi-functional and fluid space, perfect for brunches and drinks with friends, spacious and bright for yoga and study time as well as cosy for those rainy afternoons snuggled up inside.  Upstairs the quality of presentation continues, with four spacious bedrooms and two bath/shower rooms evenly spread over the upper floors.  On the first there are two double bedrooms, with wooden floorboards and french style white shutters. The family bathroom is generously proportioned, with a three piece suite including a rainfall shower over the large tub, and solid brass fittings.  The underfloor heating keeping the tiles warm at all times. Then up to the second floor, with a large exposed brick wall and bright skylight overhead.  This floor houses another two double bedrooms, a principal suite comprising double aspect bedroom and shower room.  Both have sash windows looking out over the garden glimpsing the lovely church spire in the distance. Outside, the garden has two seating areas: a paved patio adjacent to the house and decking at the far end, together with lawn and raised border planning.Living Here... - The location of this property is fab - ideal for the morning commute, with Walthamstow Central station a hop, skip and a jump away – Oxford Circus is less than half an hour from the front door, as indeed is Hampstead Heath via Queens Road station.  And if you’re meeting friends, then where better than to head into Walthamstow Village, where there are more bars and eateries than you can shake a stick at, and up to Ravenswood, where the neon is always glowing at God’s Own Junkyard and is home to several breweries where you can sit and drink outside.  The house is right by Hoe St with exceptional pizza at Yard Sale and SoDo and also in proximity to the St James St area with all the culinary experiences at Crate.  If it all gets a get too much, the house is also within a stone’s throw of Thomas Gamuel Park (if you have any canine or feline members of the family they are going to love this house too!), so just relax on a bench in the park and watch the world go by…!In The Owners Words... - “We’ve loved living in this beautiful home in this little pocket of Walthamstow.  Just a 10 minute walk to the Village, with close access to both the Hoe St and St James St areas it's right in the middle of things.  It also only takes 8 minutes to walk the tube, which provides a fantastic balance of life in London.  We enjoy just being in the house: both the bright, open, spacious feeling of the extension and the snuggly hygge vibes in the living room and bedrooms.  Then also the garden with barbecues on the patio, lying out on the grass and gardening, eating, reading or doing yoga out on the decking.  We've also been blessed with a friendly neighbourhood, which has a real community spirit.  We love walking up to the Village with great food at Eat 17, getting the best fish n chips on Orford Rd, and all the other options for eating out; then up to God’s Own Junkyard and all the breweries for a night out, and so many great pizza places with Yard Sale, So Do (Hoe St), and The Italian Bakery (St James St).  Due to the many transport links the whole of London feels at your fingertips.  We regularly swim at Parliament Hill Lido and walk on Hampstead Heath and door to door it only takes 25 minutes from Walthamstow Queens Rd (a huge bonus because of our position in the area).  We enjoy running up to and around Hollow Ponds, the mysterious park where Alfred Hitchcock grew up and also Wanstead Park with it’s lake and grotto, only 10 minutes drive away."Dimensions: - Entrance - Via front door leading into:Entrance Hallway - Staircase leading to first floor. An exceptional four bedroom, 1930s end of terrace gem, this immaculately presented home is close to great transport links and nestles in the greenery of sought-after Upper Leytonstone. Enjoy speedy access into town, while having the tranquil greenery of Wanstead Flats at your fingertips. The perfect place to leave the City bustle behind.IF YOU LIVED HEREYou'll be delighted by your light, inviting hallway welcoming you to your breathtaking, open plan, ground floor. A gorgeous 1930's style fireplace teams with sumptuous herringbone parquet flooring for a high-end aesthetic.  Your rear reception area leads to your split-level garden, perfect for entertaining at summer socials.In your splendid kitchen, pristine ivory tiles and matching ceramic flooring contrasts with a wood style countertop that offers a wealth of culinary space. Here, luxurious biscotti carpet gives a cosy feel, while muted ochre, cornflower blue and almond white give a relaxing vibe. Towards High Road Leytonstone, Luna Lounge is you new destination for live music and local indie shops meet your every need. ??WHAT ELSE??- You're ten minutes from Leytonstone tube for the Central line, whisking you directly to Liverpool Street in fourteen minutes, putting the City around a half hour away door to door. Leyton Midland Road is eight minutes on foot, should you fancy a promenade in the sea air at Southend.- Your new local is the welcoming Heathcote & Star, just four minutes away, with its dog-friendly outlook and leafy beer garden, offering a carefully curated cocktail list and ravishing roasts from the kitchen team at Root Hoof & Claw.- Parents have the choice of no less than fourteen schools rated  ‘Good' or ‘Outstanding' within a mile.Garden - 8m x 7m  (26'2" x 22'11" ) - Hall - Reception Room - 4.17m x 3.60m  (13'8" x 11'9" ) - Reception Room - 3.50m x 2.87m  (11'5" x 9'4" ) - Kitchen - 4.41m x 2.80m  (14'5" x 9'2" ) - Bedroom - 2.38m x 2.33m  (7'9" x 7'7" ) - Bedroom - 4.17m x 2.92m  (13'8" x 9'6" ) - Bedroom - 3.52m x 2.92m  (11'6" x 9'6" ) - Bathroom - 2.36m x 2.31m  (7'8" x 7'6" ) - Bedroom - 5.41m x 3.53m  (17'8" x 11'6" ) - Eaves Storage - Ensuite - A WORD FROM THE OWNER...."We love that we're close to the shops of Francis Road and yet can easily take a walk up to Hollow Ponds and have a beer on the huge outdoor terrace of the Alfred Hitchcock Hotel. Even closer to home are the Heathcote and Star, Solway Society, Gravity Well and an okonomiyaki with a great glass of wine or a craft beer at the Fillybrook. Both the Central line and the Overground are close by for easy access into the centre. Sometimes we'll walk a bit further and buy a fantastic steak from the Ginger Pig and some amazing fruit and veg from Harveys up in Wanstead. It's a great place to run; as well as Hollow Ponds, you can easily run through the Olympic Park and along the canal to Victoria Park. In Leytonstone itself we'll probably miss the excellent dim sum at Panda and the great Sardinian food at Mora the most of all."

**UNEXPECTEDLY AVAILABLE** If you are looking to house a large family, perhaps with different generations living under one roof then look no further. The current owners extended this 4 bedroom property around 15 years ago to add a 2 storey, self-contained 2 bedroom annexe with its own kitchen-breakfast room, living room, bathroom and entrance. The two sections of the property are connected via a door on the ground floor making it ideal for occupiers wanting independence or perhaps even an Airbnb. We feel there is scope (subject to consent being obtained) to extend and remodel the property further, perhaps with a large kitchen extension to the main property or a loft conversion like the next-door neighbours. The large rear garden is well screened by mature trees, being utilised by both parts of the property. There is space to park 2 cars to the front with the potential to create more parking subject to the usual consents being obtained. It is around 10 minutes (0.5 miles) walk to Eltham station that has frequent services to Charing Cross and Victoria in around half an hour so is ideal for those needing to commute into central London but who want to live in a leafier location.Eltham is located in the Royal Borough of Greenwich, around 3 miles to the east of Blackheath village and just over 4 miles to the south of Greenwich town-centre. There is plenty to do in the vicinity with Eltham Palace, former home of King Henry VIII around 1 mile away. It is described by English Heritage as one of London's best-kept secrets, boasting 19 acres of award-winning gardens. Severndroog Castle is around 1.3 miles away and offers 360-degree views of the city from the Gothic tower. Keen golfers can enjoy the private members-only Royal Blackheath Golf Club just 6 minutes (1.2 miles) away by car or Eltham Warren Golf Club - one of England's oldest 9-hole courses is just 2 minutes away (0.6 miles) by car. Eltham High Street and Westmount Road boast numerous cafes, restaurants, and independent shops. Your young ones' educational needs are well served with a Catholic Primary and Secondary School just 0.2 miles and 0.7 miles away respectively, and an Ofsted outstanding primary school (Eltham C of E ) around 0.4 miles away. Commuters will enjoy the short 10-minute walk to Eltham train station which has frequent services to London Charing Cross and London Victoria in around 30 minutes.Owners Remarks:-This house has been a fabulous family home for over 40 years. We fell in love with it the minute we viewed, with the size of the rooms, high ceilings and general character. Its versatility has worked so well over the years, enabling family and friends to stay over within their own space. We love that the garden offers all day sunshine, seclusion and an array of wildlife. It's a lovely area to live in with a great community spirit. We will be sad to leave and shall certainly miss living here, but in our later years we are now in need of a property that better suits our needs.

We can't get enough of sunny south-facing gardens (and there simply aren't enough of them!); find this low-maintenance one attached to a beautifully-presented two bed bay-fronted Victorian terrace with a separate study. Welcome features throughout the property include stripped floor boards, stripped doors, sash windows, and bespoke shutters to the front windows. We like the wide side return too - an obvious extension project once-in if you fancied it. You could also rework the layout upstairs if you wanted three bedrooms.  The lovely home rests on one of Peckham Rye's principal tree-lined streets within Holly Grove Conservation Area, just a few minutes by foot from Peckham Rye Station (Zone 2), Warwick Gardens, Bellenden Road and Rye Lane. Permit-parking is on-street.  From the hall, it's a right into the double-reception room which stretches over 24 feet. Catch pleasing sight of the garden from the second reception's sash window. Alcove shelving and a period fireplace further impress.  At the foot of the hall you've got your double-aspect kitchen/diner (running over 16 feet) with a generous bank of modern fitted gloss-white units, and a tiled floor. At the foot of the room, painted timber-framed French doors open out to your sun trap status garden. This is decked and paved on two levels, with well-established borders and clever built-in timber seating (which incorporates storage for garden bits/cushions).  Up the stairs and you'll first reach a neat study space with sash window and ceiling-high built-in cupboards/utility to the opposite wall.  Beyond, you've got a classy bathroom with traditionally-styled bathroom suite, over bath shower, on-trend brick-style tiling and recessed lighting.  From the main landing find your twin-sashed master bedroom to the front of the house; it's over 13 feet by over 11 feet. Adjacent is a second double (over 11 feet by over 8 feet) with big sash window to garden views.  Getting around? Walk three minutes to Peckham Rye Station for Overground and regular train services. City-bound buses are also local on nearby Rye Lane (cut through Choumert Grove Car Park for your easiest route here).  Good shops, pubs, cafes and restaurants surround the house. We really like Petitou (for coffee and people-watching) and Review (for a fine read plus a nice chat with Katia). Flock & Herd is a great local butcher too, and The General Store has treats galore!  Local restaurants include some of the tastiest and freshest offerings in London. Some of our favourites are The Begging Bowl, Artusi, Tonkotsu, Peckham Bazaar, Levan, The Coal Rooms, Ganapati, Mr Bao, Good Neighbour and Miss Tapas. Local pubs include The Montpelier, The Prince Albert and The Victoria Inn.  Trendy Peckham Levels, The Market Building, and The Bussey Building & Copeland Park complex are also a brief stroll; Rye Lane also has fruit and veg stalls and handy high street shops, banks and supermarkets.  For more options, central Camberwell and East Dulwich's Lordship Lane are close.  Local schools? Include The Belham (run by Dulwich Educational Trust) and Bellenden, and also The Villa Nursery and Pre-Prep. on Lyndhurst Grove.  Your closest green spaces are Warwick Gardens,  Peckham Rye Park and Common's 113 acres and Goose Green. For more options, Burgess, Ruskin and even Brockwell Parks aren't far.

This award-winning house has such wonderful design details throughout, that you really need to watch our property video to fully appreciate all the care, attention, and quality and then arrange to view this property.You will see that everything throughout this house is designed to fit perfectly making practical use of every space and giving it a sense of flow as you move from room to room and floor to floor.A three-storey dual aspect town house with a sun trap roof terrace on top, open plan second floor living space with fitted double bedrooms and well-appointed bathrooms on both the ground and first floors and a utility room.The architect Adam Howard has created a stylish house, the facade has a projecting section over three floors, oversized high performance feature windows and a huge wooden plank finished door. Internally he has used a pallet of materials, natural oak, light tones of grey and raw steel along with bespoke joinery solutions throughout. Lots of light from large windows and a retractable glass roof, that provides access to the roof terrace on top of the building. The sliding glass rooflight box is motorised controlled be a secure pad and has a rain sensor, which closes when it starts to rain.Wooden floors throughout, a bespoke fitted open plan kitchen that has a perfectly designed window in place of a worktop splashback which slides open to provide access to the bespoke window box herb garden and wider views of the treetops beyond. Full height interior doors with stylish ironmongery fittings that add to the overall quality of the design and feel and compliment the relentless joinery.Both bedrooms have extensive fitted wardrobes and storage space, wall mounted flat screen televisions and reading lights as well as recessed fitted night and day curtains.Both bathrooms have white sanitaryware, good quality tiling complemented by bespoke joinery vanity units and lighting.The three oak staircases have downlit handrails, the top staircase leads via the impressive glass opening onto the third-floor roof terrace of 10 square metres. The deck has panoramic views as well as up lights and downlighting so great for entertaining or relaxing day or night.Carefully located subtle and versatile high quality modern LED lighting which highlight architectural features with recessed strip lights and spotlights and high-quality fittings.Some other unique features include the three-story window that provides light in the entrance the first-floor landing and forms the back of the fitted desk in the open plan living room. The cantilevered piece of furniture that floats above the living room floor providing a shelf for your television and a little screen to the fitted desk and staircase beyond.On the ground floor there is a utility room complete with appliances, the boiler, more storage shelves, and cupboards.This building is constructed in blockwork with some parts in a steel frame and benefits from a Professional Consultants Certificate, it was completed in 2019.A well-insulated dwelling with solar heated hot water and an EPC rating of B. An impeccably appointed five double bedroom Victorian mid terrace in central Leyton. Here you're located on a tree-lined street with the social hub of Francis Road minutes away and the transport links of Leyton tube within easy reach. Your rear garden's south-east facing for a sunny disposition, and that's not the only natural space around. Coronation Gardens are a seven minute stroll, with Leyton Jubilee Park a stretch further. Head in the opposite direction for Wanstead's endlessly explorable great green expanse and you'll forget you're in London.IF YOU LIVED HEREYou'll be dazzled by the unequivocally exquisite and expertly realised interior design at play here. From the strikingly stained dark timber floorboards and intricate ceiling moulding that greet you in the hallway, to the beautiful exposed brick design nestled in the penthouse, this is a home with attention to detail poised to delight at every turn. Your 135 square foot front reception's a fine introduction with its bay window framing a leafy street vista and glossy wooden boards underfoot.Next door, past a WC with an on-trend luxury wallpaper feature wall, and you'll find the heart of your new home - your impossibly refined 500 square foot kitchen/diner. The kitchen comes with a chef's oven and contemporary black and brass suite of cabinets with matching pendulum lights over the breakfast bar. Deeper into the dual aspect space and a lightwell plus recessed spotlights in single file illuminate the room, while bi-folding floor to ceiling patio doors throw open the entire space to the garden.Step out here for natural effect Trulawn dotted with mature, ivy-adorned foliage; an ideal spot for soaking up the sunshine. Back inside, past the hallway (and access to the eighty five square foot cellar) and up the stairs you'll find three impeccable double bedrooms, the largest just as suitable for use as yet more sociable space. The family bathroom's an elegant affair with a rainfall shower over the clawfoot tub, gorgeous jade tiling and vintage fixtures and fittings, while head up to the second floor for another immaculate double bedroom to the rear. Lastly, your 230 square foot principal bedroom, a vision in exposed brick, rooftop views and a boutique chic en suite, is frankly a residence in itself.Outside and Leyton tube station is seven minutes on foot to whisk you into central London in less than half an hour door-to-door via the Central Line. Here you're also just one stop away from Stratford for the mega mall that is Westfield. Or hop on to the Overground at Leytonstone High Road for the Gospel Oak to Barking line, a mere thirteen minute walk away. Just around the corner is our go-to spot of Francis Road, a popular part-pedestrianised destination bursting with independent stores and eateries, while our up-and-coming Grove Green Road hub is half a mile away. Look out for newcomer Arch Deli.WHAT ELSE?- Kids have a choice of twenty primary/secondary schools in a one mile radius, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted. The 'Outstanding' Newport Primary is five minutes' walk.- Your new abode is chain free, so we can get you in with minimal fuss.- Fancy a filling breakfast or leisurely brunch? Head to Figo around the corner on Leyton High Road for a Full English, a toasted salmon bagel or mushrooms and fried egg on toast. Uniquely Charming Three Bedroom Victorian Home With Pretty Garden and City Views - CHAIN FREE.Over three delightful floors, this elegantly presented three bedroom period home is awash with sympathetic styling, quirky features and wonderfully bright accommodation. The current owners have lovingly augmented the house over 30 years to include a spectacular open plan first floor living area, three double bedrooms (two of which can be made into one huge space), a super slick shower room and wc. A cute, sunny rear garden and tiptop flat roof with electric skylight access and stunning views of the city are the cherries on the cake. We're sure you're going to love it! Fielding Street, whilst supremely convenient, boasts numerous, similarly quaint period homes. The area leaves you within easy walking distance of Camberwell, Walworth Road and the very lovely Burgess Park.Freshly painted period railings introduce the property. There are entrances on the upper and lower ground floor levels. Heading upward you meet an original door in vibrant pink, with frosted panes and brass knocker set . The inner hall greets you warmly with pretty cornicing, wooden flooring and some stunning designer wallpaper on the risers of the original staircase. The hall leads left to a handy spot for coats and brollies. A seamless laundry cupboard enjoys some particularly dishy floral designs. The front facing double bedroom has a wide original sash window, coving and more quality wooden flooring. A recessed sliding door saves on space. Opposite this, facing rear over the garden, is the salubrious shower room where funky teal flooring and a swanky double shower make for the perfect pamper parlour. The fixtures and fittings are matt black and there's a trough-style wash hand basin and contemporary loo. Heading upward to the first floor you find a most wonderful open plan reception/kitchen which enjoys light from all directions. Twin sash windows to both front and rear and four contemporary skylights create a magically airy and bright space to lounge, dine, entertain and cook. The kitchen is well stocked and contemporary with composite counters and dark brown cabinets. A bespoke steel staircase with oak treads leads daintily upward to the flat roof which is accessed through a nifty electric vertical glass door. From there you can spy the pretty local chimney pots and fantastic sweeping views as far as Canary Wharf! The lower ground floor hosts two further double bedrooms, ingeniously separated by a floating mirrored wall. The front room has direct access via stairs that lead up to the street. The rear room, presented in burnt Mexican Orange, offers garden access through double doors. A neat wc completes this level and there is further garden access on the lower return. Transport options are numerous with a multitude of buses whizzing up and down Walworth Road to all corners of town – you can catch a bus to Victoria, Whitehall, West End, Euston and Kings Cross, City, London Bridge and Borough Market. Trains to the City are a mere 6 minutes and the tube at Elephant & Castle or Kennington will take you direct to the city and into the West End. Head down Camberwell New Road for more options at Oval Tube. There's a host of shops within easy walking distance including a Marks & Spencer’s - that's dinner sorted. Walworth Road has a number of convenience stores for fresh fruit and veg, a post office and numerous banks – that’s everything covered. Camberwell has a host of bars and eateries - we love the Crooked Well, The Hermits Cave and The Camberwell Arms. Burgess Park is a short walk if you fancy a stroll.

Dishy two double bedroom Victorian terraced house, with a low-maintenance west-facing part-walled garden, directly opposite Lucas Gardens; lovely views of which can be lapped up from the property's master bedroom. There is clear potential to extend the characterful property - either up in the loft (which currently offers lots of storage space), over the side return, or both!  The location's a desirable residential street which is close to central Camberwell and Peckham too - walk just 10 minutes to Denmark Hill Station, and 14 to Peckham Rye Station. Permit-parking is on-street.  The house has been carefully renovated and improved over the current owner's long occupancy, delivering many welcome features, including stripped floors, period fireplaces and custom-made storage.  A walled front garden fronts the house. In the front door and your wooden-floored double-reception rests to your left. This extends over 22 feet. The front sash window has plantation shutters, which offer privacy (and look great as well!). There's built-in storage to one alcove and a delightful period fireplace. The second reception space has pro-papered walls, and glazed double doors which open out to the side-return area of the garden.  Back to the hall and past the handy under stairs cupboard and you'll find the double-aspect kitchen/dining room, with a practical tiled floor, and which stretches over 21 feet. The timeless fitted kitchen leads to a natural dining space - with delightful garden views and a sunny orientation. Designer wallpaper again features, plus a back door out to the garden.  The easy and established garden has been professionally landscaped and has a handy little outhouse off the back of the house.  Up to the half-landing and you'll find a large and double-aspect full bathroom, with both bath and independent walk-in shower. Built-in storage further impresses, as does a stylish heated towel rail. A couple of welcome storage cupboards (one a large boiler room; the other a slim cupboard) are found on the half-landing outside the bathroom.  From the landing proper, you have your first double bedroom, of over 10 feet by over 9 feet, with a cute original feature fireplace.  Finally, find the master bedroom to the front of the house. Twin sash windows provide leafy park vistas over Lucas Gardens. What a treat in Zone 2! Generous built-in closets, another fireplace and alcove storage tick more boxes.  St. Giles Church and Churchyard are utterly lovely local landmarks, and you're also close to South London Gallery, plus Camberwell's iconic art college buildings. It's a very nice part of town. Beyond Lucas Gardens, you've got lots of other green spaces around and about - Brunswick, Ruskin and Burgess Parks for example, and Lettsom and Warwick Gardens too. Peckham Rye Park and Common and Brockwell Park and Lido aren't far either.  Local schools include Lyndhurst Primary and The Villa Nursery and Pre-Prep. School.  Restaurants, cafes, pubs and bars are strong and varied round this way. We particularly like The Camberwell Arms (more than a pub - the restaurant offering is delicious), Grove House Tavern, The Crooked Well, Silk Road and Theo's. Walk to Peckham's Bellenden Road and Rye Lane for other excellent offerings - including Artusi, Ganapati, Levan, Peckham Levels and The Bussey Building, plus handy high street shops, pop-ups and markets.  Butterfly Tennis Club and Zen Yoga studio are also nearby, on Camberwell Grove, as well as the Victorian leisure centre with big pool, gym and classes. You are close to two Fare Zone 2 stations as previously mentioned, and also to a host of day and night bus routes at the foot of the street, from Camberwell Church Street. For more options, Peckham, Herne Hill, Dulwich Village, East Dulwich, Brixton and New Cross are all easily reached. Fascinating fact... interestingly, the pioneer radiologist Dr F S Pepperdene once lived in the house - feel free to ask us for more details.

This peaceful, tree-lined neighbourhood is just a short walk from Queens Road, which has recently seen a lot of redevelopment. Your closest hangouts are Beer Rebellion, Peckham Cellars, The Prince of Peckham, and the new restaurant Naifs. Sainsbury's is also right around the corner. Every day, new places open their doors. Notting Hill Trust is currently working on a number of regeneration and infrastructural projects, including the construction of 300 new houses, which will be completed in 2021. The proposed Bakerloo line station at Asylum Road is soon to improve the area. Queens Road is one of the local transportation options. Peckham Station (Zone 2), which provides rapid, direct connections to London Bridge, Canada Water, and Clapham Junction, is less than a half-mile away, as is Peckham Rye Station (also Zone 2), which provides direct connections to Victoria, the City, and Kings Cross St Pancras.There are also excellent bus connections to Central London, the City, Waterloo, Elephant & Castle, and Greenwich - as well as to surrounding shopping, entertainment, and other amenities, which are made even easier by the proximity of Rye Lane and Camberwell. The Peckham Library, Peckham Levels, and the Peckham Pulse Leisure Centre are all within walking distance. Bright and welcoming three double bedroom flat-fronted Victorian terrace, with a deep south-west facing rear garden (hello sunshine!) - which extends over 55 feet. Parking is unrestricted on the street. Freehold.  Find the handsome home on a quiet, tree-lined residential street in Nunhead, close to Nunhead's high street and Nunhead Green Conservation Area. You're also close to all things Peckham.  Station-wise... you have Queens Road Peckham, Nunhead and Peckham Rye all within easy walking distance (walk eight, nine and 12 minutes respectively). All are Fare Zone 2.  A neat front garden graces the front of the house. You open directly into an opened-up double reception room of over 22 feet by over 15 feet. Wooden floors and alcove storage, plus plantation shutters to lower window panes (in the front reception space) all impress. There's an under stairs cupboard for coats and such, and next to this you open into the generous double-aspect kitchen/diner - which runs over 22 feet with a fully-tiled floor. The fitted kitchen is a modern style with plenty of units and worktop space.  Access the garden via a back door here (extension potential alert), onto a paved area - ideal for al fresco meals - which leads to a generous lawn. Beyond is a raised deck with shed (which is staying).  Up the stairs and from the half-landing, find your windowed bathroom and separate w.c. (modern white sanitary ware in both) to your left, and at the rear of the house is your first double bedroom, of 8 feet by over 8. Garden vistas are enjoyed from the window here.  From the main landing, you've got your second bedroom on your left - of over 10 feet by over 9 feet, and a delightful master bedroom of over 15 feet by nearly 11 feet - with built-in closets running one entire wall, two double-glazed windows, and a dark green hue to the walls.  What's local? Central Nunhead has excellent independent staples: Ayre's bakery and FC Soper wet fish shop, for example. Strong establishments to eat include Four Hundred Rabbits, The Old Nun's Head and Kudu Grill (all are on Nunhead Lane itself). And Peckham Bazaar on nearby Consort Road is close for pan-Balkan cuisine and a wonderful wine list.  The Bussey Building & Copeland Park complex, plus Peckham Levels and Market Building are also just a short walk from your door - for the trendiest of eateries, drinkeries, plays, exhibitions and the like (don't miss the rooftop bars in the warm months). We like Tonkotsu for Ramen, and Forza Wine particularly. The triangle at the end of Peckham Rye Park and Common's 113 acres is also awash with places to eat, drink and hang out; Good Neighbour, Mr Bao, Banh Banh and Voodoo Ray's being a handful. Bellenden Road, Choumert Road, Blenheim Grove and Rye Lane dish up more food and drink options; we especially like Miss Tapas, Artusi, Levan, Il Giardino, The Begging Bowl and Ganapati. Camberwell, New Cross and Deptford are also no great distance by bus, cycle or foot.  Kids or thinking of? Local schools include Edmund Waller, Ivydale, Oakdale, Rye Oak and St Mary Magdalene C of E primaries. Banana Moon Day Nursery on Machell Road is also close.

This delightful four-bedroom home offers a vast amount of space which has been tastefully developed into the loft, allowing plenty of room for a larger family or those needing extra areas for hobbies or work.Bay windows offer lots of natural light to all rooms, while the stained-glass feature windows and fireplace add style and character to main reception and bedrooms.Situated in a popular residential the house is beautifully decorated in clean, neutral, colours with wooden flooring throughout, allowing room for any new owners to put their personal stamp on their home while showing off its traditional hallmarks.With plenty of kerb appeal, thanks to a large driveway suitable for parking up to three cars and an arched porchway, this house invites any visitor with its sense of space.The large downstairs reception areas provide everything needed for family meals or entertaining friends. Winchmore Hill is nearby and on the Great Northern Railway Line offering further transport links to the capital and beyond.Further transport links include the A110, A10 and A1 which are within an easy drive while bus routes travelling regularly to and from the area are within easy access.There is also an incredible selection of schools including nursery, primary and secondary - all within easy access thanks to the excellent transport systems.Osidge School has also had good ratings with high scores for creating a harmonious community while St Andrews Southgate, with a maximum roll of 210 pupils, prides itself on its close, supportive and inclusive community.Ashmole Academy is an unashamedly academic secondary school, with a proud record of excellent GCSE and A-Level results.  Similarly, nearby Southgate School provides a strong, dynamic education offering state-of-the-art facilities for the Arts, Sport and IT, as well as a vibrant Sixth Form centre.Denominational schools include Wolfson Hillel - a Jewish Primary School which originally opened in 1992 and is now a two-form entry nursery and primary academy with a maximum pupil roll of 480. Also nearby is West Grove Primary School - a multi-cultural, multi-faith school is situated in a new building which has been purpose designed with colourful, bright, classrooms as well as a library, art, music and drama rooms. It has received a 'good' provider rating from Ofsted.Outdoor space in the location of this property is also readily available, with a selection of parks offering a range of areas to explore all year round. Oakwood Park offers its own playground facilities making it ideal for families with children while Grovelands Park is popular for all ages.Add the choice of shopping and leisure facilities available within a short distance, there is something for everyone in this area - probably why houses that become available in this postcode are rarely on the market for very long.

A well-presented and recently rennovated Grade II listed, two-bedroom house situated on the Duchy of Cornwall estate, overlooking the prestigious Courtenay Square and in the heart of Kennington. The house is situated on the edge of the square and the entrance is on the side. As you enter the house you will find the reception room on the right, and the kitchen and dining room on the left.The reception room is a charming space enjoying views of the square. There is space for an L-shaped sofa, coffee table, and additional free-standing storage. The dining room enjoys French doors leading out onto the garden and a smart tiled floor. There is space for a large dining table and chairs, and there is also a large storage cupboard in the corner. The kitchen is extremely modern and stylish in design, with white gloss cabinets and plenty of worktop space. There is also an integrated double oven, electric hob with extractor fan above, dishwasher, fridge/freezer and washing machine. At the back of the kitchen is a shower room and W.C.  The first floor consists of two double bedrooms with storage. Between the two bedrooms is a beautifully finished bathroom with a large walk-in shower, W.C., sink with storage below and vanity mirror above, and a heated towel rail.It is worth noting that the dining room, kitchen and downstairs bathroom all benefit from having underfloor heating.The garden, accessed from both the kitchen and dining room, is a charming space enjoying complete privacy, offering the perfect place for relaxing and alfresco dining.Location:Courtenay Square is a delightful square located just off Kennington Lane. A good selection of local shops, bars and restaurants can be found nearby.Directions:Vauxhall Overground /Underground Stations are approximately 0.6 miles away (Victoria Line & National Rail). Kennington Underground Station (Northern Line – both branches) is only 0.5 miles away. In addition, there are numerous bus routes nearby, which offer easy access to Central London and beyond.
