Charming three bed Victorian Freehold terrace with south-facing garden plus roof terrace (which sits off the third bedroom), on one of Peckham's loveliest - and most requested - streets, within Holly Grove Conservation Area. Walk just four minutes to Peckham Rye Station, and you're closer still to Bellenden Road. Chain free.  A walled front garden sets you back from the pavement. Once in, a generous reception room sits to the right of the hall. In here, find a big bay window, pale walls, an opened-up fireplace, and stripped floors. Adjacent is a dining room of over 11 feet by over 8. It's currently used as a fourth bedroom (this works well as you've dining space beyond the kitchen). Passing the neat under stairs w.c. to your left, the kitchen and breakfast room lie ahead. The fitted kitchen area has white units and windows to the side return area, and is 16 feet by over 7. Beyond this is a casual, double-aspect dining space of 9 feet by over 7, with French doors onto the delightfully-sunny and split-level rear garden. The part-walled garden's relaxed and low-maintenance by design.  Up to the first floor and to the rear of the house you have a small double bedroom with French doors onto a generous and paved roof terrace. Next door is the property's bathroom, with simple white suite, over bath shower, and large square window. Up to the main landing area and you have a double bedroom off to your left (over 11 feet by over 8 feet, with sash to garden views), and the master bedroom across the front with two sash windows (this room's nearly 14 feet by over 11). Stripped floors feature in here, and a Victorian feature fireplace looks great between the alcoves.  Walk just a couple of minutes west to meet with Bellenden Road for cute and useful shops alongside restaurants and cafes. We like Flock & Herd, Review, Artusi, Ganapati and The Begging Bowl especially. This locale is well-loved by locals and visitors alike. Local pubs include The Montpelier, The Victoria Inn and The Prince Albert. Loads more social and shopping options are found on Blenheim Grove and Rye Lane - including The Bussey Building and Copeland Park, Peckham Levels, Levan and The Coal Rooms. Local green spaces include Warwick Gardens, Lettsom Gardens, and Peckham Rye Park and Common. Local schools include The Belham and Bellenden Primaries, and The Villa Nursery and Pre-Preparatory School (ages 2 through to 7) is local - on Lyndhurst Grove.  Peckham Rye station is a mere and pleasant four minute walk, with direct services to Victoria, London Bridge and Thameslink stations. You've also got London Overground trains, so all London commutes and adventures are easily achieved.

There is also a plethora of storage within the eaves.Wanstead is well served with quality local schools; you have twelve primary/secondaries in a one mile radius alone, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted. The 'Outstanding' Wanstead Church School is less than a quarter mile on foot.The wild wide open green space of Epping Forest is just a third of a mile on foot. Stroll through the greenery and you come to Hollow Ponds, where you can hire row boats and explore the waterways in the company of friendly ducks.Heading to the West End? Wanstead station will whisk you to Tottenham Court Road in twenty five minutes.

This fantastic 4-bedroom period family home, with a generous west facing garden is located in the heart of Honor Oak, moments from the high street, Honor Oak Park station and popular primary schools .Providing just under 1500ft2 (150m2) of flexible living space, you enter through the front door and there is a private front reception room to your right with squared bay window. Behind this you have the rear reception room and double doors leading out into the garden. There is also a downstairs WC and then a good sized modern fitted kitchen with units down one side and a fabulous bay window to your right. The garden is generous, extending to 36' and is west facing.  There is also a 24' cellar providing ample storage space.On the first floor there are three bedrooms and a family bathroom/WC. There is a further double bedroom on the second floor. The loft void has been partially redeveloped to provide eaves storage. The property can be extended on both the ground floor and into the rear roof slope on the second floor to provide further accommodation if required and create an even larger house, STPP and the usual consents.Honor Oak Park is much sought after due to is community feel and great transport links into all parts of London. The station is a mere 5-minute walk from where there are services into London Bridge (in around 12 minutes) as well as Overground services northwards to Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington, and southwards to Croydon. The area's amenities include coffee shops, a deli, a beauty salon, and several highly-rated restaurants including a hip pizzeria (Mamma Dough), an award-winning Indian (Babur), a popular Italian (Le Querce) and a traditional Turkish (Hattush). For groceries, there are a number of convenience shops and a Sainsbury's local along the high street. There are several places for an evening drink including Grounds and Grapes and the Brockley Jack where there is also a small theatre. The nearest primary school is the highly-rated Stillness. The area is dotted with green spaces including One Tree Hill and Blythe Hill Fields at the top of which are panoramic views of the London skyline.

NEW TO THE MARKET is this well presented Edwardian terraced property, offering a total of 1301 sq ft of internal living accommodation that is situated on a quiet, tree-lined residential road within the Dollis Hill Estate. If someone was asked to build a property for a thoroughly modern occupier, this would be the ultimate design.Turning into the large gated driveway, flanked by an attractive storage area, there are few people who could deny a very positive first impression.Aluminium frame windows and external doors and floor to ceiling glass either side of the main entrance on the ground floor, give an immediate taste of good things to come - and a dramatic impact from the outset.Access to this very desirable property is through a large driveway which is flanked by a modern and secure storage area. Once inside, choose to go down to the lower ground floor with its massive 800 sq ft of space, which houses a large open plan kitchen and living area, ensuite bedroom, utility area guest WC and two outdoor private patios - or up, to two large bedrooms, also both ensuite with the master encompassing a large balcony.Downstairs, the clean, grey steel, lines of the kitchen units are neat, tidy and exceptionally efficient. Coupled with the utility area, this space houses everything that is needed for day-to-day household chores. Bifold doors from the reception area lead out to a stylish patio area, entirely secluded thanks to high end walls and fencing, retaining the luxury of total privacy! Flexible spacing allows for a choice of use and ease of maintenance thanks to the clean lines and understated but classy décor.The en-suite bedroom on this floor also has access through bifold doors to a similarly secluded patio area, offering an opportunity for a completely different outdoor experience. One provides access to a 25ft wide balcony, again through bifold doors, with the other room offering different qualities with a large eaves space.The floor to ceiling glass in the rooms bring nature into the home, providing exceptional light and space to create a very special ambience.This unique property is a one-off and provides a chance for a discerning purchase to own something truly unique and eye-catching. Situated in one of Bounds Green's most popular residential areas, this home exudes style and charisma. It has a personality of its own; bright, light, clever and perfectly considered in all aspects. LOCATION  This property is situated in a location that is ideally suited to all kinds of needs - from transport links and shopping facilities to schools, open spaces and leisure opportunities.Travelling to and from the capital is straightforward as both Bowes Park BR station - on the Southern Railway service - and Bounds Green tube (Piccadilly line) are within a very short walking distance. There are also plentiful bus routes with regular services in and out of the area and the A406, North Circular Road, is also nearby.A variety of schools for all ages are easily accessible from Goring Road. Bounds Green and Bowes Primary schools within a half mile. Both have excellent ratings with parents and students alike and good ratings from OFSTED.St Martin of Porres is a one form entry Catholic school, having one class of children for each of the seven year groups in the primary range of 5 - 11 years.  It also has a nursery class of 3 - 4 year old children.  Trinity Primary Academy, Garfield Primary and St Michaels are also very accessible and all claim to offer a safe, stimulating and supportive atmosphere where children can succeed.When it comes to secondary education, Broomfield School is very close to this property. It is a small community school with a family atmosphere, dedicated to helping children to reach their full potential.St Thomas More Catholic School is rated as outstanding by OFSTED and is a mixed, independent Academy within the Cardinal Hume Academies Trust.  Although it is a church school, it welcomes applications from those of other faiths or no faith who share the school's ethos and values.  With a capacity of 1200 students, including Sixth Form, it claims to be large enough to be able to offer a diverse curriculum whilst maintaining a focus of the progress of the individual.For those seeking the outdoors there are plenty of open spaces within short distances including Bluebell Wood, just across the A406, White Hart Lane recreation ground and Bromfield and Arnos Parks.There is also no shortage of restaurants, pubs, leisure facilities, supermarkets and shops to ensure all lifestyle needs are met in the local area.To organise an accompanied viewing, please contact our sales team at your earliest opportunity to avoid potential disappointment.

Strike is pleased to present this LARGE, FOUR BEDROOM Victorian property in a sought-after location!  This spacious bright property offers plenty of light and space with high ceilings and period features. Spanning over three floors with four double bedrooms, there is natural hardwood floors throughout and feature fireplaces that can be used! You will not be disappointed upon entering the property with the abundance of space and a pleasant garden with a green park across the road at the front of the property for walking and enjoying sunny days.  Comprising of an entrance hall, a large living-dining space with a bright bay window, a fully fitted kitchen with tiled flooring and access to the rear garden. The first floor accommodates three double bedrooms and the main bathroom that has a claw foot tub for soaking. On the top floor, there is a larger than usual fourth bedroom that can be changed into two bedrooms as it was before and an ensuit. The property is conveniently located within a short walking distance to Stratford International, West Ham and Plaistow Underground Stations providing overground, cross rail, DLR, Jubilee, District, and Hammersmith & City lines. There are also convenient bus routes located within the proximity of the property with the A12 and A13 short drives away for links into London and the rest of Essex and surrounding areas. City Airport is also close by with Stratford Westfield Shopping centre a stones throw away. The property further benefits from on-street parking via residents permit. Viewing highly recommended to appreciate the potential on offer.

GUIDE PRICE £900,000 - £970,000A well presented three bedroom family home offering two reception rooms, kitchen, downstairs cloakroom, three bedrooms and a bathroom. Outside provides a detached garage, off road parking, side and rear access to spacious rear garden. A beautifully presented and unique two bedroom, three storey house with gated access located just off Merton Road, SW18. This fantastic house benefits from spacious accommodation throughout and access to a private patio garden and private roof terrace. Arranged over three floors the property is approximately 1300 sq ft and is in excellent condition throughout. The ground floor comprises of a large kitchen diner, an extensive reception room which opens onto the South-West facing patio garden and a guest cloakroom. There is a spacious lower ground floor room to the property which could be used a second reception, study or cinema room. On the second floor you have two double bedrooms with large built in wardrobes and two bathrooms (both en-suite), as well as access to the substantial west-facing roof terrace. The property is accessed through a gated private shared driveway on Merton Road. It is well situated for all of the amenities of Wandsworth and the excellent selection of shops, bars and restaurants of the nearby Putney and Southfields. It is served by the District Line tube stations of Southfields and East Putney as well as the overground station of Wandsworth Town. For the motorist there is easy access to the A3 making it an ideal location for getting into central London and the South. An early viewing of this unique property is highly recommended.

Composed of a reception hall, two reception rooms, a fitted kitchen and dining room, access to a tranquil good-sized garden. James Pendleton are delighted to offer to the market a well proportioned four bedroom modern townhouse set within a quiet gated mews. The development is set back from the road and accessed via a secure gate. Once through the front door of the property you are greeted by a large entrance hall which leads through to a generous open plan reception room/kitchen breakfast room with integrated appliances and offers great entertaining space. Sliding doors from the reception room lead out to a patio garden and off the hallway is a downstairs guest cloakroom. There is also access to the patio garden via the hallway. On the first floor there is a master bedroom with an en-suite bathroom, and a second double bedroom with access to a balcony. The top floor comprises two further double bedrooms and a main bathroom. The property has an allocated parking space and there is also visitor parking available. This fantastic property further benefits air conditioning and underfloor heating throughout the ground floor. Adams Mews is located just off Trinity Road, within easy reach of Tooting Bec Underground station and close to the amenities and transport links local to Balham and Wandsworth Common.

VIEWING DAY SATURDAY 12TH MARCH. Offering plenty of potential is this charming 4 bedroom, 1930's semi detached family home benefitting from an additional loft room, a rear conservatory, double glazing throughout, off street parking and a good size private rear garden. The house raised from street level and set well back offering plenty of privacy, also has off street parking for one car. A path with steps leads up to the house which is bordered by mature plants and shrubs.  Through a front porch is the main entrance that leads into a good size hallway housing the staircase that has a storage cupboard underneath. At the front of the house is a good size reception room that has high ceilings and a large bay window that fills the room with natural light. The back of the property has been opened to create a generous kitchen dining room. The kitchen wraps around one side of the room in an ‘L’ shape with plenty of wall and base mounted cupboards with an integrated oven and grill. There is a white tiled splash back and a worktop that houses the sink and hob. A patio door to the side and a sliding door from the kitchen both lead out to the conservatory. The conservatory offers access to the side return via a door to the side and there is also a shower room with toilet and wash hand basin. Windows look out to the garden and a patio door offers direct access. The garden is a good size extending to 41 ft (12.5m) with an array of mature plants, shrubs and trees along the left-hand side and there is a large workshop and shed to the right with a pathway down the middle. Upstairs on the first floor there are 4 bedrooms and a shower room. The largest of the bedrooms is at the front of the house, it has fitted cupboards along one side of the room and a large square bay window mirroring the reception room below. Adjacent is the smallest bedroom which would make a good child bedroom or a study. The two other bedrooms are located at the back of the house overlooking the garden and are of equivalent size. The shower room is in the middle of the house off the landing, it has a walk-in shower enclosure, a wash hand basin and a toilet that sits beneath a frosted window that offers natural light and ventilation. The loft space has been converted to create an additional room. There are skylights in the roof offering natural light and there are large eaves storage cupboards around the room, one of which houses the boiler. The loft space has potential to add a dormer to maximise the space in the room, subject to the normal planning consents.Overhill Road is twixt Dulwich, Forest Hill and Honor Oak Park, providing easy access to all the amenities these areas offer. Nearby is Lordship Lane with all its wonderful shops, bars and restaurants as well as Forest Hill Road which has a great parade of shops etc inc The Watsons General Telegraph Pub. Green open spaces of Dulwich Park, Sydenham Woods, Horniman gardens and Brenchley gardens are also nearby. There are plenty of buses to take you to central London and you have the choice of East Dulwich, Peckham Rye, Honor Oak or Forest Hill stations nearby. There is also a good selection of highly rated primary schools, the closest of which is Goodrich Primary which is only 320 meters away. This house has been a fabulous family home for decades and is looking for a new family to take care of it for years to come.

A home with plenty of period charm. This huge three-bedroom Victorian house with South Facing Garden, offers a space of circa 1700 sq. ft. The property boasts traditional Victorian hallmarks such as high ceilings with intricate cornicing's, ceiling roses and fireplaces. Convenience is also a big factor here, within Minutes, you have Turnpike Lane Tube Station (Piccadilly Line – Zone 3), Hornsey BR, and the numerous bus links along Green Lanes.THE PROPERTYThe home is presented with a through lounge, built with stunning high ceilings. The first reception room is furnished with large bay windows with a front aspect allowing the sunlight to shine throughout.  The dining area is spacious in size leading straight into the kitchen which is built with ample storage and worktop space and equipped with a gas hob and oven. The kitchen area provides direct access to the south facing private garden which has mature lawn and with some love can be something very impressive. This is the perfect place to test your gardening skills. The first floor of the property holds the first bedroom which is a large double and you have the family bathroom on this floor as well. The family bathroom is fitted with a panel bathtub and even a bidet. On the top floor you have two large double bedrooms both built with large windows adding to the brightness of the property, radiating from top to bottom. If all that was not enough, the property holds a full width cellar free for the new owner to use how however they wish. THE LOCATIONTo get around town, you have a host of transport links. Situated within walking distance of Turnpike Lane Underground Station (Piccadilly Line Zone 3) and Hornsey BR providing direct access to London Liverpool Street and most major parts of the City. Local to the property is the renowned Harringay Green Lanes, which has no shortage of local stores selling fresh produce, bars/pubs, restaurants and quirky coffee shops. Providing perfect spots to shop, dine and relax. Not forgetting the selection of green spaces surrounding the area such as Duckett’s Common Park and Chestnuts Park. Please call us to arrange a viewing.‘Think…Property Inc!’

Stepping into the entrance hall, (with underfloor heating) you get a sense of space which runs throughout the home, (1765.28 Square ft.)The property features an  original stained glass window in the hallway and half moon double glazed windows in the front lounge and bedroom too. Price Guide £900,000 - £950,000Set within the Fairfield Road Conservation area and forming part of this charming residential enclave, is this impressive red brick, double bayed, Edwardian house. Spanning over 1237 Sq Ft this house has been developed to create a bright and expansive living space. Combining an eclectic décor and a wealth of original period features, this property provides the perfect mix of charm and style.Entering the front door you are greeted with exposed floor boards which run through the entirety of the ground floor arrangement and an eclectic décor with bright colours and patterns which would uplift anyone’s day. Heading into the front reception room you immediately acknowledge the hand finished white Marble fireplace with matching hearth which complements the additional period features of the stripped floor boards, sash windows, column radiators, picture rail and cove cornicing. Via French doors you can then head through to a lavishly sized dining area which is full width of the house allowing the perfect setting for dining/entertaining friends and family.  Entering into the back half of the home the sleek and streamlined kitchen blends beautifully with a contemporary edge with its clean lines, organic work top and uncluttered vibe. Finishing off the downstairs is a cloak room.Upstairs the charm and character continue, the main bedroom boasts exposed floorboards, high ceilings, bay window and the added benefit of an en-suite. The second bedroom is a comfortable double size boasting a beautiful feature fireplace and the added benefit of a door leading to a roof terrace. Completing the first floor there is a family bathroom which combines up to date stylish looks with a hint of traditional characteristics that are in keeping with the age of the home.Fairfield Road is an area of particular special architectural and historic interest, illustrated by its rich history, significant architecture and mixed character all dating back from the 19th century. This sought after location is well-positioned for the shops, cafes, market and amenities of the Roman Road whilst the open green spaces of both Grove Hall Park or the award winning Victoria Park are just moments away. Nearby transport links include Mile End tube station (Central Line) and Bow Road tube (District Line) and Bow Church DLR, all offering swift and direct links to The City, Canary Wharf and West End.

Adjacent to Brick Lane, nestled within the ever sought after Shoreditch, this spacious and stylish house is ideal for anyone seeking their first home within a creative corner on the fringe of The City.Built in 2014, this modern home was sympathetically constructed not only to suit the immediate setting, but also modern living standards and with social dynamics and comfort in mind. A mechanical heat recovery system and solar panels on the roof ensures running costs are low, whilst the vendor has installed air conditioning to the bedrooms. Integrated speakers are set within ceilings throughout. The addition of remote controlled electric blinds on all floors makes for an enviable smart home.Floor to ceiling window openings flood the living spaces with natural light, with a double height ceiling and mezzanine level opening up the ground floor kitchen / diner space to the first floor living area. The open plan kitchen features Corian surfaces, Smeg appliances and a breakfast bar adjacent to the dining area. The first floor provides a generous living area and an ideal corner for a study area if working from home, with both this and the second floor finished with an oak hardwood floor.The second floor houses both double bedrooms. The principal has been upgraded to include bespoke storage beneath the vaulted windows with fitted wardrobe opposite. The second bedroom offers a further double with fitted wardrobe. A small, enclosed courtyard area to the rear opens into a shared communal yard, with bike and bin storage and right of way access.SituationGrimsby Street is located in the heart of Shoreditch, within yards of Brick Lane, nearby a vast array of vibrant bars, restaurants, boutique shops and galleries. It is also a short walk to both Brick Lane and Spitalfields, sought after enclaves for culture, food and crafts.This central location provides excellent transport links with Shoreditch High Street (Overground), Old Street (Northern Line and National Rail) and Liverpool Street (National Rail, Underground with the future prospect of Crossrail) stations all within walking distance.

A contemporary kitchen leads onto a bright and airy breakfast area flooded by natural light and affording views overlooking the beautiful and low maintenance garden which offers a patio area to laid lawn, box shrub borders either side, decked area perfect for entertaining in the summer months and a useful garage to the rear which can be accessed via the adjoining Rodney Road. On the first floor there are two generous double bedrooms with the main offering ample built-in wardrobes and bay window with shutters mirroring the reception below, third single bedroom or study/office ideal for working from home and a sizeable four-piece family bathroom with separate free standing shower. The extended loft now incorporates a spacious fourth bedroom with a modern en suite shower, Juliet balcony and eaves storage remaining. Ideally positioned within close proximity of the highly regarded and Ofsted 'Outstanding' rated Nightingale Primary School, along with Wanstead High Street and Central Line station (0.8 miles) only a short walk from your doorstep. For more information or to arrange an appointment to view, please contact the office at your convenience.

On the outside, it’s a traditional, bay-fronted Victorian property with imposing front and period detail. But inside, it’s a breathtaking contemporary home, renovated with a singular vision and so much care.The reception room is simple and cosy, a lovely spot to relax in the evenings, and the original stripped wood floors are dark stained and create a deep contrast to the white walls. You can feel an easy flow of natural light throughout the home as we pass the downstairs WC and enter the kitchen diner, which has enough room to sit and relax as well as dine and cook; with overhead skylights increasing the sense of scale even further. It’s cosy despite being a large space, due in part to the underfloor heating; and it’s designed for a family to be comfortable together, while doing their own things.The dramatic Crittal doors open out onto a natural garden with established shrubs and borders, and a pergola in the garden adds interest and privacy.  Upstairs begins with a bright, open hallway. There’s a family bathroom both on the first floor and in the loft conversion. The bedrooms are doubles, and feel fresh and airy with room for storage. Nothing is flash here, it’s just simple and modern and built for comfort.You’ll be living in an area of Walthamstow, where everything you need is within walking distance. There’s a variety of local schools in the area and you’re just a few minutes walk from the village, with its local shops, great pubs, cafes and restaurants. And to get away from it all, you’re only a short cycle away to acres of natural green space at Hollow Pond.Transport is on your doorstep too, whether you need Overground, tube or bus, with both Walthamstow Central and Walthamstow Queens Road stations within a 10 minute walk. Charming Two Bedroom Period Home With Loft Room. GUIDE PRICE £900k to £945k This handsome Victorian two bedder will effortlessly command your attention with its numerous charms. Tasteful styling, original features, a pretty patio garden and a super attic/study space means you're more than well catered for. You've also got every conceivable amenity on your doorstep - including the wonderful Bellenden Road! Peckham Rye station, in addition to unbeatable services to London Bridge, hosts the fab London Overground line - it'll whisk you to Shoreditch, Islington, Hoxton or Clapham in no time at all!Enter off the winding, leafy and tranquil Elm Grove in through a neat front space with high mature hedging. An arched recessed portico presents a period door in Farrow and Balls' 'Green Smoke'. This leads into an inviting hallway with high ceilings, timber flooring and an original carpeted staircase. The double reception welcomes you with an open log fire to the front - a real joy come winter. There's an aspect to both front and rear, low level fitted storage and a further feature fireplace with good-looking mantel. Toward the end of the hall you find a handy understairs storage space. The dining space comes next with fitted storage and plenty of space for the family dining table. The bright, well stocked contemporary kitchen adjoins to the rear of this boasting sleek white cabinets, one and a half bowl sink, four ring Induction hob and oven. This and the dining space each face directly over the patio garden which plays host to a healthy array of plants and shrubs. Your guests can easily spill out and mingle at the house warming bbq!Heading upstairs you'll find a beautifully presented bathroom still has the original feature fireplace. A lavish roll top bath, period style suite and walk-in shower make for the perfect spot for the morning ablutions. The insatiably bright master bedroom fronts the grove with two large sash windows. The room is carpeted and has a neatly placed staircase with open risers that leads to the attic room. Here you've got space enough for any amount of endeavours - begin writing those memoirs or alphabetise that shoe collection. The second bedroom is back on the first floor with a rear aspect and another feature fireplace.The locale really leaves you within a stroll of anything you might need. Rye Lane offers its unique London bustle and all the high street shops. Transport wise you're equally well catered for with nearby Peckham Rye Station - which in addition to London Bridge services supplies the fab London Overground Line. Further services include Blackfriars and Victoria (all between 9-14 mins). Buses head into town from Rye Lane and Peckham Road, night buses included. Bellenden Road offers some exciting places to eat and drink. Bar Story is close for a cocktail on the patio, and East Dulwich or Camberwell are near for a change of (local) scene.

Set on a popular tree lined Victorian avenue within trendy Bermondsey, is this exceptional, mid terrace, period house. A wonderful, three double bedroom home that has been lovingly maintained and upgraded throughout, sympathetically combining original period features and character with contemporary fixtures and fittings. Stylish with a genuine sense of charm, the living space extends to an impressive 1112 Sq Ft. Naturally bright with a wonderfully calm ambience you are immediately drawn to the substantial 21ft reception room. Offering ample room to relax and dine in style, exposed floorboards and a period feature fireplace reflect the period and style of the house. Further to the rear you discover a lovely kitchen diner. Also generous in size, with space for a small dining table if you wish, an ideal breakfast room and a real hub for the house. From the kitchen to the side return is a conservatory Lean-To. A delightful garden room that provides a real sense of inside-out living. The modern, four-piece bathroom sits to the back and is just lovely. Beautifully tiled and bathed in natural light from windows to the rear and two large skylights, the freestanding roll top bath and a large walk-in shower complete the sense of luxury. Upstairs you have the bedrooms, all three are generous doubles, quiet and again immaculately presented with ample built-in wardrobes. The master extends to 15ft and the bedroom to the rear conveniently offers a separate WC and sink. Outside, the garden is larger than most at 55ft at the longest point. Established borders and a paved terrace complete the look. Further benefits include a small front garden and residents permit parking.Lynton Road itself is centrally located within SE1 and very much at the heart of a rich, community driven area and perfect for those looking to enjoy the bars and restaurants of nearby Bermondsey Street, Borough and Shad Thames. Further delights on your doorstep include the food markets of ,Maltby Street, Borough and Spa Terminus while transport links via nearby Bermondsey and London Bridge stations offer easy access into the West End, City and Canary Wharf. Bus links are excellent too, with the day and night routes number 1 and 78 moments away and for those that prefer to cycle the Quietway is literally on your doorstep.The area also offers great potential for capital growth with the proposed Bakerloo extension due to place a station just a short walk away. A house of real distinction.Energy Efficiency Rating D.

The PropertyForming part of the riverside Sovereign View development, this end of terrace mock-Georgian townhouse offers a rare taste of character against the backdrop of Canary Wharf over the water. To the second floor you have the master bedroom with views of the Thames, plenty of fitted wardrobes and en-suite shower room. Rare to the market is this grand and imposing Victorian double fronted corner property with five bedrooms, garage and garden offering potential to split into two dwellings (STPP) having a front door in Warwick Road and one in Reginald Road (at present not in use).  It's all located just off West Ham Park, and a short fifteen minute stroll from Stratford.While the property would benefit from updating it will make a fantastic opportunity for a large family or developer to make their mark. Viewing is advised to appreciate the potential that this unique property has to offer.IF YOU LIVED HEREYou'll be stretching out in these stately Victorian proportions, with over 1700 square feet of living space and high ceilings to make your own. Your vast 300 square foot through lounge is a vintage treat in its own right. Dual aspect,with glazed internal doors to the rear opening up to yet more hosting space, and with that double bay window to the front, you have lashings of natural light throughout.There's a timber panelled statement wall, a gorgeous vintage stone surround atop the hearth, original cornicing overhead. Step into your timber panelled rear sunroom and you have leafy green views of your garden via wall-filling windows. It's quite a courtyard; with patio, flower borders and beautiful eighty year old apple tree.Back inside and your kitchen's a bright, lengthy space of 150 square feet,  with a sky blue paint job and matching cabinets. You have yet another reception and the ground floor bedroom behind the second flank of your double frontage, both generous spaces of around 150 square feet, each finished with the property's signature vintage character.Upstairs all four bedrooms are superbly balanced doubles ranging from 120 to 160 square feet, each with its own character and fittings. The fourth bedroom acts as a second kitchen, that can be converted back into a bedroom. Your family bathroom completes the interior, while in your garden you have that wonderful double height barn of a garage. A wealth of private parking space or an exciting development opportunity? It's up to you.As noted Stratford is within easy walking distance, for all the many and varied shopping and leisure delights of Westfield, the world famous post-2012 landmarks of the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and the incomparable underground, overground, international and, soon, Crossrail transport links of Stratford station. Even closer to home, the vast green space of West Ham Park, site of the first FA Cup goal in history, is just a few steps from your front door. Ideal for morning jogs, evening strolls or exercising furry friends.WHAT ELSE?- You have no fewer than thirty two schools rated 'Good' or better less than a mile away on foot, with an impressive twelve deemed 'Outstanding'.- As well as that tempting garage, you have a vast cellar to turn to all manner of uses whether that be a home working space or simple storage. You may even be able to develop the untouched loft space into your own whole new storey, subject to the usual permissions.- The former Olympic Athletes Village, now dubbed East Village and reimagined as 'London's Coolest Postcode' is well worth the twenty minute stroll or short hop by Uber. It's packed with independent, artisanal wining and dining establishments. An exceptional gated mews development of five freehold houses in leafy Hither Green, South East London - created, in part, from a former carpentry workshop. This is so much more than just another new housing scheme. Every aspect of the design and architecture has been a collaboration between designer Matthias Felsch and sculptor Jeff Lowe. It represents their belief that new homes absolutely can combine style, functionality, and individuality. Jeff was keen to ensure that the houses all had dedicated creative spaces, while Matthias saw to it that, whilst there is an extraordinary amount of floor space on offer, each one is a practical home as well. Number 3 is one of three town houses and is slightly larger at 150 square metres. As with number 2, accommodation is arranged over three spacious levels but the twist lies in its outdoor space. Rather than a top floor terrace, this house has a walled rear garden which becomes an extension of the large living area once those oversized bi-fold doors are thrown open.On the first floor you will find two double bedrooms and two bathrooms; the minimal, clean lines balance well with the natural tones Matthias has used. Spanning the top floor is a cavernous studio with high, beamed ceilings whose cool limed finish create a gently industrial feel. As will the other houses in the mews, this space lends itself to all sorts of activities: a gym, further reception space, vast bedroom or a studio/office that would hold a serious-sized business.The focus of the design is very much the consolidation of home and work. the integral tech is thoroughly up to date, with Cat 6 cabling and local fibre broadband should you want it, while clever internal lighting options give total control over your environment.This quiet corner of South East London is something of a hidden gem. It is a desirable residential location but with Hither Green Station more or less on the door step, it is a gateway to London and beyond. Trains to London Bridge, Charing Cross or Cannon Street are frequent and take around ten minutes. There is also the option for a change at New Cross for the Overground to Shoreditch and North London or head to Lewisham and grab the DLR for Canary Wharf, Stratford, or The City.Lewisham's constantly evolving town centre is close by. You can take a train or bus there, but it is an easy walk. There is lots on offer here in terms of shopping and eateries but, closer to home and on either side of the tracks, there is an equally impressive selection of coffee houses and places to eat and drink. Found Hope Store on Hither Green Lane offers some fine artisan fare, coffee, and wine. You could also take cocktails at, Bobs just a few doors down. On the other side of the railway you can enjoy the food, drink, and atmosphere at the Station Hotel - something of a local landmark these days. It sits in what feels like an urban village, very quiet and also close to the green spaces at Mountsfield Park, Manor park & Manor House Gardens.

Pretty three bedroom Victorian terraced house of 1012 square feet, on a quiet residential street with unrestricted parking. The house incorporates a large loft extension, and potential remains to extend on the ground floor. A lawned garden of 35 feet completes the package. Freehold.  You're really close to Peckham Rye Park and Common's 113 acres, the beautiful green space of Nunhead cemetery, and also to volunteer-run Aquarius Golf Club. Your local stations are Nunhead, Peckham Rye and Brockley; all are circa a mile from the house (and Fare Zone 2).  Open directly into the open-plan reception room - with the stairs dividing living and dining areas. It's a generous space at over 24 feet by over 12 feet, and welcome and characterful features include a wood-burning stove and stripped original boards to the floor.  The kitchen lies beyond: a timeless Shaker-style one, with wooden worktops, and double-glazed French doors out to the low-maintenance garden.  Up the stairs and you've got the property's bathroom to the rear - with a tiled floor, sash window, neat white sanitary ware, and an over bath shower. Next door is a double bedroom with sash window to garden views, and the second (twin-sashed) double bedroom takes the width of the terrace (over 13 feet), to the front of the house, with a feature fireplace. Both bedrooms have stripped floors and white walls.  Up to the second floor and you've got an impressive large third bedroom - an obvious master - of over 18 feet by over 11 feet. Wooden floors, skylight windows, a Juliet balcony and accessible eaves storage tick even more boxes.  Green space? Peckham Rye Park & Common is your most local green space (walk five minutes) - comprising a Victorian Park and historic common; a pleasant refuge for both the local community and wildlife. It's home to ornamental gardens, streams, woodland and a lake, playgrounds and a cafe, plus outdoor gym. The park has been awarded Green Flag status and has a long, rich and engaging history - it was recorded as being cultivated before the Norman Conquest in the 11th Century! At the tip of the common you have a host of cool eateries and such - including Mr Bao, Good Neighbour and Banh Banh, and trendy hairdressing salon (Blue Tit).  Bellenden Road, Blenheim Grove and Rye Lane are also close for yummy restaurants (we love Levan, Ganapati, The Begging Bowl and Artusi), cool bars and pubs, Peckham Levels, and The Bussey Building.  You're a short stroll from Nunhead and East Dulwich's town centres too. In Nunhead we like Kudu Grill and El Vermut, plus Ayres bakery and FC Soper wet fish shop. Brockley's also close for more options, and for pubs - The Ivy House, The Waverley, The Herne and The Angel Oak are all strong locals.  Local schools are good; your most local is Ivydale Primary.

This substantial 3 bedroom freehold house offers over 1300 sq ft, has off street parking and has a rear garden. The ground floor comprises of  a studio room, w/c with hand basin in white and eat in kitchen. The kitchen has a range of high and low units in beech effect, with integrated hob, extractor fan and double oven.  There is a tiled splashback and tiled flooring. There is a door leading to the rear garden, which has a brick storage unit and rear gate to allow access through the rear of the property. The first floor has the large reception room, which is bright and airy. There is a double bedroom and the family bathroom. The bathroom has a white suite and mosaic tiles, with  blue tiled flooring. The second floor comprises of two further double bedrooms and storage cupboards in the hallway. Victorian Grove is in the heart of vibrant Stoke Newington between Stoke Newington Church Street close to boutique shops, pubs and restaurants and trendy Dalston. There are excellent transport links including Rectory Road Station into Liverpool Street, Dalston Kingsland Station, Dalston Junction Station and a wide variety of local buses into The City and West End.  For recreation Clissold Park and Hackney Downs are within walking distance.

A 4 double-bedroom, 2 bathroom townhouse with integral garage in a highly regarded, gated development with well-maintained communal gardens.Prospect Place offers the best of both worlds, a secluded environment in the City.  A safe place for the family in a quiet residential area with beautiful well-maintained communal gardens, yet it's ideally placed for local amenities, St Peters School, riverside restaurants, pubs, delis, local shops, parks, and the market.  All the things that make Wapping a unique and attractive place to call home.  When one has to go to the office the station is just 5 minutes walk and the City or Canary Wharf an easy commute; a rather pleasant one if you decide to walk or cycle.This lovely home comprises of 4 good-sized double bedrooms all with plenty of space for storage.  There's a shower room on the ground floor and bathroom on the top floor.  An open-plan kitchen dining room and a 4.3m long integral garage.  It's a versatile property, currently set up for room by room letting with an income of over £3000 per month, but can easily be converted to a more conventional family home.    Priced with a quick sale in mind this is a great opportunity for a family home or a turnkey investment in our wonderful neighbourhood.

This immaculately presented four bedroom family home is ideally located in a quiet enclave close to the many attractions of Winchmore Hill and just a 15 minute walk from the station. The property has been sympathetically extended by the addition of an extension over the former integral garage and the conversion of the loft space to create a generously sized double-fronted property. With four double bedrooms, a study, utility room, and gym in addition to two large entertaining spaces, a thoughtfully designed garden, and extensive off-street parking, this house caters to all the needs of modern living.The ground floor main living room is light and spacious extending to over 25ft. It has a large bay window to the front and a second bay with glazed double doors to the rear garden. This flexible space is currently configured with sofas and a TV in the front half of the room, which features an ultra-modern electric holographic fireplace with Venetian plaster surround, and a dining area to the rear.The kitchen/dining room to the rear of the house is a first-class entertaining space, with views and easy access to the garden via large glazed double doors, an extensive well-equipped kitchen, a wraparound bar seating area, and plenty of space for a dining table or sofas. The adjacent utility room houses an additional sink and hob in addition to laundry machines. This west-facing room has good natural light, with windows along two walls and a lantern roof light. Internal glazed doors and windows, the kitchen skylight, and downlighters maximise light throughout the ground floor, which also has a gym and WC. The second floor has three double bedrooms, a family bathroom, and study. These are arranged around a central stair, emphasising both the lateral space and natural light. All bedrooms have charming bay windows, feature lighting, and laminate wood floors and the main bedroom has a bespoke storage wall. The hotel-style bathroom is recently updated, with a contemporary freestanding bath and a walk-in double shower. The small study which overlooks the rear garden is currently used for storage. The top floor suite comprises a large double bedroom with an en-suite shower room, dressing area, and bespoke built-in storage. A Velux window on the landing and additional window with garden views optimise light levels.The property has a large block-paved front garden with space to park two cars and a thoughtfully designed west-facing rear garden which is an ideal outdoor living space. With a large paved patio, raised beds, artificial turf, pergola, and outdoor kitchen it has been designed with maximum enjoyment and minimal maintenance in mind. Every detail has been considered in this property and great care has been taken to create an ideal environment for work, play and rest.

Guide price £850,000 to £900,000The house is FREEHOLD, offered CHAIN FREE, split over three floors and offers flexible accommodation with over 1100 sq ft of space. What the owners say:‘We adore this lovely family home boasting spectacular panoramic views across London - in clear sight are the Houses of Parliament, the London Eye, St Pauls Cathedral, the Gherkin, the Shard, Canary Wharf, Battersea Power Station and more. Offering a downstairs cloakroom, semi-open planned kitchen, dining area and lounge, opening onto a patio/outdoor eating area overlooking a large private, low maintenance garden the house offers a lot to enjoy. The property has four double bedrooms, two bathrooms (one on-suite) and the added bonus of having off street parking which is ideal in London. We found the house to be well situated for close transport links leading into central London and a short walk to a diverse café culture, popular restaurants and impressive range of independent shops and good schools - including the impressive Dulwich College and St Francesca Cabrini Catholic School. A large Sainsbury’s supermarket is a short drive away which is super handy.  The house is in the quiet, leafy suburb of Honor Oak with excellent nearby local amenities include riding stables, cricket clubs, swimming pool. It is a short walk to Honor Oak Gardens, Brenchley Gardens, Horniman Museum and Gardens, Dulwich Park and more’Both Forest Hill and Honor Oak come under the SE23 postcode and have become increasingly popular in recent years hence they’ve been featured on the popular TV programme “Location Location Location” several times.  SE23 has much to offer from boutique shops, thriving independent businesses on the high street, a great selection of green spaces and recreational facilities to great transport links and highly regarded schools.  If you're seeking a family home in proximity to well-regarded schools and a local train station with travel times to central London of approximately 15 minutes (to London Bridge) you should certainly consider this house.  Some of the best known public schools include: Ofsted rated "Outstanding" Fairlawn. Ofsted rated "Outstanding" Stillness. Ofsted rated "Outstanding" Rathfern. Ofsted rated "Good" Dalmain. You will also find a selection of independent schools locally one of which is a Montessori and the other is the highly acclaimed St Dunstan's which is also ranked in Ofsted's top 10%. Transport to central London station from Honor Oak train station includes some of the following travel times: London Bridge in approximately 15 minutes London Victoria in approximately 35 minutes  Canary Wharf in approximately 24 minutes Some of our favourite local eateries include Mama Dough (a sour dough pizza restaurant) and the award-winning Babur Indian restaurant. There’s also the Honor Oak gastro pub and a selection of boutique cafes and shops.  There's also the popular Le Querce which is run by a Sardinian family serving traditional dishes.  Local attractions include One Tree Hill which is just at the top of Honor Oak Rise and offers some of the most breath-taking views across London and the city skyline.  You will also find nature reserves in proximity of the property on Devonshire Road and Garthorne Road.  The Honor Oak sports ground is also close to the house. It boasts a great children’s playground and is highly rated on Google reviews. Forest Hill Library and pools have both undergone complete renovation in recent years. Forest Hill pools has fantastic swimming facilities but also has a well equipped gym and exercise classes.  Blythe Hill Fields which is approximately 0.9 mile away and is known by the locals for its recreational facilities and regular events. One such facility is the Trim trail which is an exercise trail and we mustn’t forget the yearly Blythe Hill festival that brings local business and the community together for a day of fun.  You may look up details about Blythe Hill Fields on their website:   The Horniman gardens and museum is another well-known local point of interest. With regular events such as a farmers market and live music, we believe this will be of interest to many buyers.  You can read more about the Horniman museum and gardens via the below link:   We look forward to answering any questions and arranging your viewing.NOTE: Images are for illustration only as tenants currently occupy the property

Large modern-build terraced house of 1355 square feet with four double bedrooms and two bathrooms. Live in or let out - it's great for either setup. And with so many rooms it can be used really flexibly for working from home, accommodating guests or a growing family etc.  A low-maintenance south-west garden (with access from the dining space) completes the package.  The location's strong as well! Walk just four minutes to Brixton Station (and Overground), and nine to Loughborough Junction Station. Brixton Recreation Centre is also but a few minutes away.  In your front door and you've got a large hall space with under stairs storage for coats and such (a downstairs w.c. in here too). The large wooden-floored reception room is set to your right. This is nearly 25 feet by over 11 feet - providing easily for generous seating and dining zones, with period-style central fireplace in the front reception space. Double doors open at the foot of the room onto the sunny garden.  A neat kitchen completes the floor, with modern wall and base units, a tiled floor, and large sash window to garden views.  Up to the first floor and you've got two big double bedrooms (these are the same size: over 12 feet by over 11 feet apiece), and a modern windowed bathroom with white suite and over bath shower.  The second floor hosts two further generous double bedrooms; the one to the rear boasting its own (windowed) en suite bathroom.  Coldharbour Lane is close and has delights such as Three Eight Four cocktail bar (plus small plates) and Tim Anderson's Nanban restaurant. Brixton Village has all the street food outlets you could possibly desire. Central Brixton is home to many established greats such as The Brixton Academy and The Ritzy Cinema.  Camberwell is close too and has a respectable and growing offering of places to eat and drink for all budgets, alongside useful shops, banks and supermarkets. Some of our favourite restaurants are The Camberwell Arms, Silk Road, The Crooked Well and Theo's.  Ruskin and Myatt's Fields Parks are your local Victorian parks, both have bandstands and community events, and Brockwell Park with popular lido is an easy bus ride or cycle.

A substantially statuesque semi detached four bedroom family home, with a vast flowing ground floor, driveway and rear garden. Wanstead High Street, the bustling heart of this much loved East London village, is just moments away.Home to cafes, gastropubs, fresh produce merchants and restaurants, as well as speedy transport connections and open green spaces, Wanstead Village is a firm favourite with families and City workers alike.IF YOU LIVED HERE...You'll be enjoying the mansionesque proportions, recently extended by the current owners, with more than 1450 square feet of living space across two floors. Step into your open plan, ingeniously zoned ground floor and your initial space comes in at over 200 square feet, with pale timber floors flowing underfoot and clear sightlines from front to back.It all blooms out into a beautifully bright twenty four foot wide reception across the rear, with a generous bank of sliding patio doors offering swathes of natural light and garden view. There's a wealth of independent cafes and meeting spots, with The Larder doing itself proud in the hotly contested categories of Finest Homemade Treats and Best Coffee. WHAT ELSE?- Wanstead central line station is less than ten minutes walk away and will get you to Liverpool Street in fifteen, putting the City less than a half hour away door to door. Heading to the West End? Tottenham Court Road is just nine minutes further. You also have front facing parking for 3 cars, and space to add another 3plus parking spaces- Parents will be suitably impressed with local schools, you have five primary/secondaries rated 'Outstanding' all less than a mile away on foot. A further six are deemed 'Good' and just as close.- Nature's never far away here, the great green expanse of Epping Forest starts just two minutes from your front door. Endlessly explorable, you can head for Perch Pond and walk for miles without ever seeing a road.Reception Room - 4.57m x 3.93m (14'11" x 12'10") - Kitchen/Breakfast Room - 4.97m x 3.02m (16'3" x 9'10") - Study - 2.86m x 2.63m (9'4" x 8'7") - Shower Room - Reception Room - 7.32m x 3.10m (24'0" x 10'2") - Garden - 14m (45'11") - Bedroom - 4.97m x 3.58m (16'3" x 11'8") - Bedroom - 3.70m x 2.63m (12'1" x 8'7") - Ensuite - Shower Room - Bedroom - 3.87m x 2.49m (12'8" x 8'2") - Bedroom - 3.01m x 2.56m (9'10" x 8'4") - A WORD FROM THE EXPERT..."Being a country girl at heart, for me Wanstead is the perfect blend of village/city living. With excellent transport links into the city, I often meet up with friends to explore the wonders of London. But I also enjoy going for long, leafy walks with Hollow Ponds and Wanstead Park on my doorstep.I was first attracted to Wanstead by its charming High Street, lush green spaces and choice of excellent schools. Since moving here, I have discovered some new favourites — for breakfast La Bakerie, lunch at Otto and The Duke for the best roast around.I love to stay active, and here in Wanstead you have lots to choose from. From organised yoga at Christ Church Green, personal training sessions at Target Fit or jogging around the various nature trails of Epping Forest.There is a great sense of community here in Wanstead, with informative Facebook groups, street parties, a monthly farmers’ market and the local jumble trail. I have made many friends locally, there is a genuine community spirit here and I am proud to call Wanstead my home."KYLI CLAYTON E11 ASSISTANT MANAGER

A beautifully presented two bedroom terraced house located within the Dover House Conservation Area.Extended four bedroom family home renovated to high specification. Situated on a quiet residential road, just a short walk to the shops and restaurants of Putney.The large living room features French doors that open out onto a beautiful south facing garden. Post covid many purchasers have the option to work from home, this house does have the forth bedroom set up as a studio/office. The kitchen offers a full range of integrated appliances. The first floor comprises two generous double bedrooms with ample built in storage and a family bathroom. The top floor hosts a double bedroom with en-suite shower room and ample eaves storage.Dover House Road is located within the ever popular Dover House Conservation area, benefitting from the picturesque green and located a short walk (0.7 miles) from Barnes mainline station with frequent trains to Waterloo, plus with many excellent local bus routes nearby including the no's 72 to Hammersmith, 430 to Putney/Kensington and the 337 to Clapham Junction or Richmond.

This 3 bedroom semi-detached Victorian workman's cottage is a beautifully preserved example of why this road is so well known and desired amongst locals and visitors. Situated behind a white picket fence, this spacious house has a large kitchen/dining room with direct access to the lovely south facing garden. There are grass, borders and a patio, with a summer house to the rear and plenty of scope for a home/office or similar, if you desired one. The garden is not directly overlooked which is particularly rare in this location. The kitchen is contemporary and benefits from a 5- ring gas hob, a dishwasher and wooden surfaces. Off the kitchen, there is a downstairs toilet. There is also an excellent amount of storage in the cottage. There are also original wood floors throughout the property, with under floor heating in the kitchen and modern insulation in the living room walls and floor. In the front room, there is a high specification Douvre designer wood burning stove and double glazing. You will definitely be cosy in the winter in this cottage. On the upper floors are three bedrooms, one a light and spacious attic room, with ample built-in storage and shelving.  The bathroom has a fabulous massive shower and tasteful tiling. The master bedroom also has wooden floors and great light. Nestled between Brixton Hill and Brockwell Park, the location is just fantastic. With both Brixton Underground and Streatham Hill station being only 15 minutes walk or an even shorter bus ride away, this is a super-convenient spot.

Nestled is a peaceful cul-de-sac modern development is this impressive three bedroom/twobathroom house with off street parking on front drive and a lovely southerly aspect rear garden.Pendlewood Close is located just off Queens Walk, moments from the shops and brasseries in Pitshanger Lane that serve as the centre of activity in this community. Youwon't have to wander far to enjoy a coffee or to pick up some essentials.The beautiful wide open spaces of Pitshanger Park are close by, providing places forSunday afternoon strolls or picnics.What we suspect will tempt parents most, however, is that this home falls in the catchmentarea for North Ealing Primary. The property is well placed for prestigious private schools including St Benedict’s and Notting Hill & Ealing High, St Augustine’s Priory,Harvington and Durston House.

FOR SALE is this three bedroom, semi-detached 1930s property, currently offering 1316 sq ft of internal living accommodation. The property is in need of substantial refurbishment throughout but presents an ambitious purchaser with a unique opportunity to create something truly special. A reconfiguration of the Ground Floor, and an extension at the rear (STPP), would maximise the available square footage, and result in light-abundant and expansive open-plan living accommodation. The Ground Floor is currently comprised of a large double reception and a kitchen. A sizeable 40 ft lawned rear garden is accessible through the rear. The First Floor offers two bedrooms, both of which are serviced by a family bathroom at the rear. There is a third bedroom at the front that could also be used as a home office. There would be provision to extend into the loft (STPP) to add additional square footage. Fleetwood Road is a quiet, tree-lined residential street on the coveted Dollis Hill Estate. Situated within easy walking distance of the area's amenities including a selection of local delis, shops and cafes. Excellent transport links include access from Dollis Hill (Jubilee - Zone 2) Station, good bus routes & the M1 motorway not being far away. Brent Cross Shopping Centre is also a short drive away.  The area also has access to good local state schools as well as private schools.  The open space of the stunning 86 acre Gladstone Park is nearby with its outdoor gym, tennis courts & café. Viewing is highly recommended.

Comments from the owner:Top 3 things you love about your homeQuiet, no through road which feels safeGround floor has it all, with open plan indoor/outdoor living and a quiet place to relaxThe light, house feels really spacious and bright (sun on front in morning and back in evening)Top 3 things you love about the area... Excellent proximity to Hither Green, Lewisham and Ladywell train stationsWe are walkers and are in walking distance of 3 play parks/greens as well as Lewisham Town Centre (for when we regularly have no milk it comes in handy)The Station Pub - good outside space (and a very good burger)Property Details:Superbly renovated and significantly improved by the current owners, this beautiful semi detached home offers bright and spacious accommodation with high specification finish, stylish interiors and modern design. Enviably located in a popular no-through road, the property enjoys quiet aspect, set back from the road by a generous driveway for off street parking, with a well tended south west facing garden to the rear with large decked area, pergola and useful side access.  Accommodation comprises entrance hallway with access to guest WC, stairs rising to the first floor and attractive 'Amtico' flooring (evident throughout the ground floor).  To the front of the property, there is an inviting reception room with wide front aspect window, bespoke inbuilt storage and feature fireplace with tiled insert and ornate surround.  A further generous reception/sitting room opens through to the  impressive full width extended kitchen/diner, flooded with natural light from overhead orangery style skylight windows and near-full width bi-folding doors onto the garden. This superb room offers excellent additional living space - ideal for family life - with plenty of space for relaxing and dining.  The kitchen area itself comprises a quality range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and breakfast bar area, incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor, double wall mounted electric oven, and further integrated appliances.  A door leads back through to a separate utility for additional work/appliance space.  To the first floor, there are three well proportioned bedrooms - two doubles, each with inbuilt wardrobes, and a further single - plus an elegant contemporary style family bathroom with modern free-standing bath suite, separate walk-in shower unit, and 'Jack and Jill' basins.  There is additional potential to extend further into the loft space, subject to the normal planning consents, and this work has been carried out to a number of similar properties in the road.The property is conveniently located within access of Ladywell and Hither Green stations, with Lewisham station and DLR connections also within easy reach.  The area provides an array of local amenities, with nearby Lewisham offering a wider variety of shops, bars, restaurants and leisure facilities, and fashionable Blackheath with cafes, bars and restaurants, also just a short distance away.  The area is also well served lovely open spaces including Manor House Gardens, Hilly Fields, Mountsfield Park and Lewisham Park, and excellent local schools.

Unveiled to the SE19 market is this charming four bedroom DETACHED family home situated on one of Anerley’s most desirable roads.A simply stunning, rarely available detached Victorian family home with a handsome brick façade. Arranged over three floors, the property is bursting with character and period features. The ground floor comprises of a fantastic sized entrance hall and two receptions, which have been opened up to create a sociable family living space. An inviting 21” kitchen/diner with wood burning fire offers comfortable space for informal socialising. The first floor comprises two generous sized double bedrooms and a third good size single, and a huge four piece family bathroom with luxurious roll top bath and double shower cubicle. The top floor houses a further double bedroom with plenty of light flooding throughout due to the Velux windows.Excellent transport links, with Anerley station less than half a mile away, with access to central and East London via east London line or British Rail links to London Bridge (Jubilee and Northern line). Q&A- Why are you selling? Looking to move closer to our family- What's the area like? Very central, well connected. You can reach anywhere in Central London within 20 min. Nothing beats that view.Property Details:Enviably located in a secure gated development with attractive central square just off historic Narrow Street, this stunning property offers modern living space with stylish finish and contemporary appeal. From the hallway, stairs rise up to the first floor landing with inbuilt storage and access to two well proportioned bedrooms plus a stylish family shower room.  The second floor provides bright and airy, loft-style living space with open plan reception/kitchen flooded with natural light from dual front aspect windows.  This inviting room offers excellent space for relaxing, entertaining and dining, with kitchen area itself comprising a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces and central island incorporating inset sink unit, hob with overhead extractor, electric oven, and further space for appliances.The property is very conveniently located within a short distance of the Canary Wharf business district as well as an array of fashionable shops, bars, cafes and restaurants. The River Thames and neighbouring Limehouse Marina offer excellent views and vibrant waterside amenities.

A charming four-bedroom town house set within a popular and  well-kept gated mews development - with allocated parking.Set within a popular and quiet residential development, the house is arranged over three floors and offers versatile living. Saunter through a well-kept front garden. Internally you are presented with an open plan reception on the ground floor, that measures over eight metres and rolls out on to a good-sized back garden. The reception area has wooden floors and neutral décor, with plenty of space to relax and entertain. A modern fitted kitchen sits at the other end with a good range of wall and base units, an integrated oven and hob and plumbing and space for white goods. The rear garden has a large patio area with planting bays and some well-established plants and shrubs. There is a shed at the bottom for all your tools and garden furniture.On the first floor you have a large bedroom that could be used as second reception room, it enjoys views of gardens and has the same wooden flooring that graces the reception room on the ground floor. The second bedroom on this floor is being used as an office currently but is a decent size and a well-presented bedroom. On the second floor, you have the master bedroom with an en-suite and built-in storage. The fourth bedroom is next along the hallway finished to the same standard and also has built in storage. The family bathroom has a traditional bath for a relaxing soak and a shower over the bath for the morning dash, a pedestal sink and W.C.The property is in-between two fantastic parks - Myatt's Field with its tennis courts, state-of-the-art play areas and boutique community café and Kennington Park also has a café, tennis courts and sports facilities to enjoy throughout the year. On Saturdays, you can wander over to the popular farmers’ market at St Marks church. Kennington (Northern), Oval (Northern) and Elephant and Castle (mainline, Bakerloo, Northern) stations are all less than a mile away. There are a myriad of bus routes waiting to take you into central London in under twenty minutes. You have two of Southwark’s best parks in short walking distance and the River Thames is less than 1.5 miles from your doorstep. You will be amazed at how central the location is, with the added benefit of being so close to Kennington, Brixton and Camberwell for your choice of eateries, boutiques and lively bars.

To the front of the house the first sizeable room features an original wrought iron fireplace and large bay window, an ideal room to relax of an evening. The second reception also includes a character fireplace, as well as an easily accessed cellar, handy for additional storage.To the rear of the property, the kitchen is of a size to be able to include all the essential appliances with also enough space for a small table should you wish, with access directly out to the mainly paved courtyard garden.Upstairs, the master bedroom to the front is of a generous proportion, stretching the full width of the property. The second double is also of a good size, with the remaining bedroom a single, and finally to the rear the three piece bathroom. There is also loft storage, with the main boarded loft space accessed via a fitted pull down ladder.The property is within easy walking distance of both Leytonstone Central Line Station, and even closer at hand Leytonstone High Road Overground Station which is only a few moments away. Leytonstone High Road provides a pleasant mix of restaurants, cafes and pubs to socialise by day or of an evening, as well as some useful retail outlets including a Tesco Superstore. For those looking for a more full-on retail experience Westfield is only a short journey away, so too the iconic Olympic Park.The owner commented 'I have owned the property since 2006 and have really enjoyed living in the house and area. I have friendly neighbours and there is a good community spirit. The local residents association has regular meetings and organises events such as street parties and an annual spring clean of Wanstead Flats. Transport links are on the doorstep and my partner and I regularly cycle across Wanstead Flats to feed the ducks. The garden is small, but due to its south-facing direction it receives the sun of a morning and from 1pm onwards as well - one of my favourite things is to put my feet up and enjoy a good book in the afternoon sun. I will be moving to Bristol but in the interim, I will be renting, so the property will not have an onward chain. I am sure the next owner will enjoy their time here as much as I have'.To view this property, please get in touch with one of our friendly and helpful property experts.Room sizes:Hallway: 11'4 x 5'1 (3.46m x 1.55m) narrowing to 9'5 x 3'0 (2.87m x 0.92m)Lounge/Dining Area: 25'4 x 11'4 (7.73m x 3.46m)Kitchen: 19'8 x 8'6 (6.00m x 2.59m)Landing: 18'4 x 5'3 (5.59m x 1.60m)Bedroom 1: 14'8 x 11'2 (4.47m x 3.41m)Bedroom 2: 10'9 x 9'3 (3.28m x 2.82m)Bedroom 3: 12'9 x 8'8 (3.89m x 2.64m)Shower Room: 9'1 x 4'3 (2.77m x 1.30m)Bedroom 4: 8'8 x 8'5 (2.64m x 2.57m)Bedroom 5: 17'4 x 8'4 (5.29m x 2.54m)En Suite The information provided about this property does not constitute or form part of an offer or contract, nor may be it be regarded as representations. Located on a quiet road moments from Woolwich Common, this impressive new build property boasts three double bedrooms and a 2000 sq ft garden all finished to an exacting standard throughout. Modern and minimal, this property has been thoughtfully designed to the highest of specifications to ensure a comfortable, sizable living environment. The ground floor kitchen is a bright and welcoming open plan space comprising of a generously sized lounge/sitting room and a modern kitchen containing premium worktops and market leading appliances. The space is perfect for entertaining guests with features like integrated appliances, skylights and bi-folding glass doors which open on to the charming fully landscaped rear garden, perfect for summer BBQ's and evening cocktails. The property is built with underfloor heating on the ground floor and nest thermostats throughout, ensuring the climate is always exactly as desired. It's a multi-functional and fluid space that can be molded to suit a range of ideas for hosting. The high quality presentation continues upstairs with three spacious bedrooms and two bath/shower rooms on the first floor. The two double bedrooms are fully carpeted with built in bedside lights. The rear double bedroom boasts large French doors and an abundance of natural light courtesy of the beautiful Juliet balcony. The master bedroom features a three piece en-suite bathroom containing a rainfall shower over the large tub, hanging toilet and a Bluetooth mirror to enjoy some relaxing music during a bath. Similarly the family bathroom is well proportioned and benefits from a shower enclosure as well as Bluetooth enabled fan and mirror. The second floor boasts a vast and bright bedroom with plenty of built in storage. With Ethernet connectivity points placed in each room, poor internet will never be an issue, putting your mind at ease if ever working from home. The property is thoroughly insulated and with an Energy Efficiency Rating of B, you can have peace of mind that you won't be largely impacted by the current energy cost crisis. The large private garden has already been fully landscaped and is ready to be enjoyed. Some of its many features include modern brickwork, beautiful cedar fencing, a brand new patio, lengthy flowerbeds, a sizable lawn and outdoor lighting. A unique advantage of the property is the 161 sq ft newly constructed outbuilding. This isn't your usual outhouse, it has been built to the highest of standards, fitted out with electrics, heating, lighting, Ethernet point, and a modern WC. It has the potential to be used as an office to work from home, a private gym or even a games room - the possibilities are endless.
